properties.Details: On 2/6/05 at approximately 10:33 p.m. Officer Deanna Reilly was on routine patrol and stopped a vehicle traveling at a high rate of speed in the 700 block of E. Washington Avenue.  Before Officer Reilly could exit her squad car, the male driver came running up to the squad car saying his wife was in labor.  Officer Reilly asked the driver if he needed an ambulance, at which point one was requested.  The driver returned to check on his wife who was now honking the horn.  The man came back to report that the child's head had now appeared.  Before Madison Fire/Rescue could respond, the baby had been delivered in the car with the assistance of the new father.  Madison Fire/Rescue arrived to provide medical attention and deliver the mother, baby and father to Meriter Hospital.  The family, from Sun Prairie already have two twin children.

properties.Arrested: Jacob J Verriden25 years old-Interfering w/ firefighting-Escape-Probation ViolationDonny L Orick Jr.24 years old-Interfering w/ firefighting
properties.Details: On 3/6/05 at approximately 1:08 am, Madison Police responded with the Madison Fire Department to an alleged structure fire in the 600 block of Langdon St.  Upon arrival firefighters confirmed there was not a structure fire, rather several fire extinguishers were discharged to make a smoke appearance in the hallways.  As Madison police officers continued their investigation they noticed an individual discharging yet another fire extinguisher.  There were two individuals, who do not reside in the building, who were subsequently arrested.  During the arrest process on the street, one individual fled the scene on foot while still in handcuffs.  Officers were able to quickly find the individual and transport him to the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Male, 52, Madison
properties.Details: On 4/9/07 at 7:02 p.m. Capitol Police made a traffic stop on Catalpa Circle and was asking for emergency back-up as they had an uncooperative suspect driver at gunpoint.  The responding Madison Police Officer noticed the suspect refusing the Capitol officer's commands and heard the suspect ask to be shot by police.  The Madison Police Officer gave commands as well and told the suspect that the taser would be deployed.  After a few seconds the suspect complied indicating he did not want to be tased.

Officers responded to Eken Park for the report of the playground equipment fully engulfed in flames.  Because of the recycled rubber tire base of the equipment, there was a lot of smoke in the area.  No other houses or structures near the park were threatened by the fire which was quickly contained by Madison Fire.  The cause of the fire is still under investigation.

The subject was taken into custody and processed for the above charges.  He currently is at the Dane County Jail.

properties.Details: At approximately 7:30 am this date, Officers responded to a report of a disturbance at an apartment in the 4300 block of Lumley Rd.  It was reported that one of the parties was armed with a knife.  Upon arrival, Officers contacted the victim who indicated the suspect and he had been involved in a relationship in the past.  He further indicated that the suspect showed up at his apartment this morning, forced her way into the apartment, damaging the door when  she entered, and then confronted him in the kitchen.  When she confronted him, she armed herself with a kitchen knife and threatened the victim.  The suspect fled the apartment prior to police arrival.  Suspect was apprehended in the 2300 block of Fish Hatchery Rd and conveyed to the Dane County Jail.  No injuries reported.

properties.Arrested: Daniel Littlejohn22 years oldMadison Battery to a Police OfficerResisting an Officer
properties.Details: On 3/12/05 at approximately 2:30 am Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 1900 block of N. Sherman Ave. reference a disturbance.  Officers encountered Littlejohn who had jumped on an officers squad car and then took off running.  Officers were able to catch Littlejohn who then resisted and fought with officers.  Littlejohn then kicked an officer in the face.  Due to the apparent high level of intoxicants in Littlejohns system, he was transported to a medical facility after being placed in hobble restraints.  Upon being transported from the medical facility to the Dane County Jail by Madison Police Officers, he once again tried to resist and fight with officers.  Upon seeing officers display the Taser, Littlejohn immediately complied being placed in handcuffs.  Once officers were able to place Littlejohn in handcuffs he began to kick at officers and resist commands.  Again, Littlejohn was placed in hobble restraints that restrict kicking and was subsequently taken to the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Jorge Gonzales-Guttierrez18 yrs oldMadison-OMVWOCPlacido Gonzalez-Hernandez22 yrs oldMadison-OMVWOC-Resisting
properties.Details: On 3/17/05 at approximately 11:14 pm a Madison Police Officer was on patrol and noticed an occupied vehicle at a closed business in the 5600 block of Odana Rd.  In contacting the occupants of the vehicle and verifying the license plates, the officer learned the car was stolen from the Town of Madison.  During the data check, Gonzalez-Hernandez fled on foot, while Gonzalez-Guttierrez stayed behind.  The officer, who is the K-9 handler for Gregor, was able to have responding officers stay with Gonzalez-Guttierrez who was arrested.  K-9 Gregor and the Madison Officer were able to track Gonzalez-Hernandez for approximately two miles where  Gregor found Gonzalez-Hernandez hiding behind a tree.  Gonzalez-Hernandez was subsequently arrested and both individuals were transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: Nichole Lewis32 years oldMadison-Robbery-Disorderly Conduct

properties.Arrested: Quantaze D. Campbell, Male, 07-06-1976. Charges- Warrants: Robbery, Felon in Possession of Firearm x 2, Battery w/Weapon, Battery, Parole Violation.Additional Charges- Criminal Damage to Property, Resisting.
properties.Details: At 9:10 pm on 3/24/2005, Madison Police responded to 1116 Ann St., acting on information that a person wanted on numerous warrants was in an apartment at that location. Officers attempted contact at the apartment, and discovered that the wanted subject, Quantaze D.Campbell, 07-06-1976, had fled the apartment via the window. Campbell climbed to the roof of the two story building, refusing officer orders to give himself up. Police established a perimeter around the building, and continued to give directives without avail. At one point, Campbell forced entry to the attic, subsequently entered the second floor hallway through the ceiling, and then several apartments. Campbell then reentered the attic through the ceiling, before returning to the roof. Officers evacuated residents on the second floor, while other officers responded to the roof. Several of the officers on the roof were tethered by ropes in the event Campbell should physically resist efforts to take him into custody. As police followed Campbell to the roof, Campbell fled to the roof of another building at 1114 Ann St. Campbell was able to reach the roof by climbing through a tree, whose canopy spanned the gap between the buildings. The incident was resolved peacefully when Campbell agreed to give himself up with the promise of a soda and cigarette.

properties.Arrested: Carlos L. Avilar Jr.27 years old, Madison2nd degree reckless endangering, Carrying a Concealed Weapon, Possession of a Switchblade

The confrontation ended without anything physical.  However, after Avilar entered the bar Madison Police Officers contacted him where he was arrested for the above charges.  Avilar was transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Details: At approximately 10:28 pm on 05/30/05, officers were dispatched to the 2300 block of Allied Drive regarding a stabbing.  Officers arrived and determined that a 39 year old male had a laceration to his neck.  They were told the laceration was a result of a female stabbing the victim in the neck.  Officers were told that the victim initially created a disturbance in the parking lot of an apartment building and threatened a female residence there.  The suspect then entered the apartment building and walked into an apartment which had a door adjar.  The apartment was occupied by 4 males.  The suspect shouted threats at the males and caused a disturbance within the apartment.  As she was leaving the apartment,the suspect pulled a kitchen-type knife out of her back pocket and made a stabbing motion at the victim.  She then left the apartment and officers located the suspect in the area and attempted to take her into custody.  At one point, the suspect broke away and fled on foot.  She was aprehended a short time later after a foot chase.The victim's injuries were not serious.  Madison Fire Rescue was on scene and checked the victim while he was at the scene.The suspect was arrested and conveyed to the Dane County Jail.

The second suspect remains unidentified and at large.  The subject who was arrested provided false information related to his identity and thus was charged with obstructing.  After officers detmerined who he was, they learned he had 2 outstanding warrants.  The arrested suspect was conveyed to the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Kyle and Quinn Wheaton
properties.Details: Both Kyle and Quinn Wheaton, suspects in the Rustic Tavern shooting on 7/14/2005, were arrested in Jackson, MS on 7/26/2005.  Both brothers are currently in Mississippi waiting an extradition hearing to return them to Madison, where they face attempted first degree intentional homicide charges.  Kyle and Quinn Wheaton were arrested by an FBI Task Force.  The Madison Police Department is continuing its investigation into this incident.

properties.Arrested: Frederick Earls, 7-29-65, Chicago, IL.Charges:  Failure to Have Control, Operating After Revocation, Operating While Intoxicated, 7 outstanding Warrants.
properties.Address: Eastbound ramp to Schroeder Rd from W Beltline Hwy
properties.Victim: Two Madison Police Officers received minor burn-type injuries to their arms.
properties.Details: At approximately 4:56a on 7-30-05, Officers responded to a report of an individual passed out in a vehicle on the ramp from the eastbound Beltline to Schroeder Rd and Whitney Way.  Upon arrival, Officers located the vehicle with the driver behind the wheel.  Officers were unable initially to gain entry into the vehicle.  When the driver responded to the Officers, he accelerated and crashed into a Madison Fire Department ambulance that had been dispatched to the scene.  The vehicle became lodged against the ambulance and the driver continued to attempt to accelerate, causing a tire on the vehicle to explode.  The Officers were injured by material from the exploding tire.  The vehicle then became dislodged from the ambulance and drove into a neighboring business parking lot.  Two Firefighters/Paramedics had to jump out of the way in order to avoid being struck by the vehicle.  At some point, the suspect got out of the vehicle and was apprehended by the Officers.  The vehicle continued to go in circles in the parking lot of the business.  A Firefighter was able to jump into the vehicle and shut it off.  The vehicle, a 2005 Nissan Altima, was severely damaged and had to be towed from the scene.  The Fire Department ambulance received damage in the area of impact but was driven from the scene.  Earls is currently in the Dane County Jail on the above charges.

properties.Arrested: Michael H. LaBagnara

LaBagnara was eventually taken into custody when other officers arrived to assist.  Officer Gary was treated at a local hospital for minor injuries and released while LaBagnara was booked into the Dane County Jail for numerous charges including: attempting to disarm a peace officer, resisting an officer, criminal damage to property (3 counts), violation of a restraining order, and battery to a police officer.

properties.Arrested: David D. Jessick, 25.  Robbery, Probation Hold, Obstructing, Eluding
properties.Victim: 52 year old female, Madison.  Injuries include numerous scratches and bruises.
properties.Details: On 8/30/2005 at approximately 12:33 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the 700 block of N. Midvale Blvd for a robbery that had just occurred.  The victim and friend reported a white male had just robbed her in the parking lot.  According to the victim, the suspect (Jessick) had pulled up in a red SUV, got out and grabbed her purse and bag she was carrying.  After a brief struggle, the suspect fled with the purse and took off in the SUV.  As Jessick fled at a high rate of speed, the victim fell to the ground causing the scrapes and bruising.  The responding officer aired a suspect and vehicle description on the police radio. At approximately 1:30 p.m. an officer noticed the suspect vehicle and driver on S. Gammon.  In following the vehicle a short pursuit entailed.  Jessick drove his vehicle through the backyards of homes on Mt. Vernon Ct where he was apprehended after a short foot pursuit.  It was learned the vehicle Jessick was driving was stolen as well.  Jessick was booked into the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Pierre Williams, 18, Madison

As officers responded it was learned that Williams had caused a disturbance at a kiosk and was fleeing from the pursuing employee.  As Williams fled, he ran through a glass door at a JC Penny store in an attempt to leave quickly.  The employee was able to continue foot pursuit and officers quickly learned of Williams' location.  Williams was subsequently arrested in the basement of an apartment building on Tree Lane.  At the time, Williams needed medical attention due to his injuries sustained in traveling through a glass door.  There was an escape warrant for Williams issued by the Dane County Jail prior to his arrest.

Officers responded and determined that a soccer game had just ended.  They also learned that during the game, players from both teams became involved in a physical dispute which involved shoving and pushing.  Officers also noted an injured player.  He indicated he had been struck by a player from the opposing team in the forehead which caused the injury.  The suspect was located.  He was identified as one of the players.  He was taken into custoy on the above charge and conveyed to the Dane County Jail.  The victim received treatment at a Madison hospital.

properties.Arrested: Howard Eskridge, 17, Madison:  1st Degree Reckless Endangering, OMVWOC, False Imprisonment, Bail Jumping, Violation of Temporary Restraining Order
properties.Details: On 9/6/2005 at approximately 9:21 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to Hollywood Dr reference a threats complaint.  It was learned that at approximately 1:30 p.m. on the same day, the victim left her residence in a car and Eskridge pulled up directly behind her, preventing her to leave.  The victim, still in the driveway, reported that Eskridge demanded entry into the victim's car.  Eskridge drove recklessly for approximately 30 minutes to different locations.  At one point he crashed the vehicle into a fence in the Town of Madison.  Eventually Eskridge dropped the female and the car off on Hollywood Dr.  Eskridge was subsequently arrested on Deer Valley Rd in Madison, where he was taken to jail without incident.  The victim did not report any injuries.

properties.Arrested: Bright Jaja, 28, Madison:  Abuse of a Vulnerable Adult
properties.Victim: Male, 68, Madison.  Transported to local hospital for evaluation.
properties.Details: On 9/7/2005 at approximately 1:46 p.m. a Madison Police Parking Enforcement Officer (PEO) was dispatched to the 1000 block of University Ave for a parking complaint.  The observant PEO noticed an elderly male in the back seat of a different vehicle, simply laying there.  An officer was dispatched to check the welfare of this individual.  The police officer learned that the individual inside the car was severely developmentally disabled.  The victim had been lying in the car, in 84-degree weather, and had body fluids on him. As the investigation continued, the caretaker, Jaja, eventually returned to the car after being away for over an hour and a half with friend.   Madison Fire/Rescue transported the individual to a local hospital for an evaluation.  Officers also learned through Human Services that the victim has severe developmental disabilities and needs constant care, 24 hours/day, 7 days a week. Jaja was arrested without incident and transported to the Dane Co Jail.

properties.Arrested: Wilkie L Johnson, age 40,  resident of Madison.Charges: #1 Eluding, #2 Operating Without Owner's Consent, #3 Obstructing An Officer, #4 Possession Of Drug Paraphernalia (warrant), #5 Operating After Revocation, #6 Reckless Driving, #7 Operating A Motor Vehicle With A Controlled Substance In His Blood.
properties.Details: At approximately 01:11am A Madison officer noted a stolen being operated in the 500 block of W Doty St.  The officer followed the vehicle for several blocks and attempted to stop it.  The driver fled and drove recklessly through the downtown area.  The reckless driving included speeds of 45mph to 50mph and failing to stop for red lights and stop signs.  The driver ended up abandoning the vehicle at a dead end near Vilas Park.  He fled on foot from the scene and  was tracked to an area near Vilas Park by a Town of Madison Police K-9 unit. The subject was located hiding along a fence line and taken into custody.  Officers charged him with the above offenses and conveyed him to the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Terry Rice, 24, Madison:  Possession of a firearm by a felon, Firearm in a gun-free zone, Carrying a Concealed Weapon, Possession iwth Intent to deliver facsimile drugs, Possession of stolen property, Resisting Arrest, Parole Violation
properties.Details: On 9/21/05 at approximately 10:35 p.m., two Madison Police Officers working the Weed & Seed grant in the Allied Drive neighborhood spotted an individual they believed had a warrant.  As the officers contacted Rice in an apartment parking lot, he said he was not the individual officers were looking for and he was not.  When Rice could not produce an ID to verify he was not who officers believed he was, Rice fled on foot.  As Rice was running from officers, he threw a loaded handgun.  Rice was apprehended a short time later and the weapon was recovered.  The handgun was listed as stolen from another state.  Rice was transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: Nicole Barnett, Age 19, resident of Madison.  Charge is 2nd degree reckless endangering safety.  Currently in the Dane County Jail.
properties.Victim: A 21 year old male resident of Madison.  Stab wound to his leg.  Injury is non-life threatening.  Conveyed by Madison Fire Rescue to a Madison hospital for treatment.
properties.Details: At approximately 08:18am on 09/25/05, Madison Police responded to a report of a stabbing at an apartment in the 10 block of Straubel Ct.  Officers arrived and located the victim with a stab wound to his upper right leg.  Shortly thereafter they located the suspect.  Officers determined that the incident started as a domestic dispute which became phsyical and ended when the suspect stabbed the victim.  The victim was conveyed to a Madison hospital for treatment.  The suspect was arrested and conveyed to the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: John W Osborne, 27 years old, Elizabeth Lane, Sun Prairie.  Charges are carrying a concealed weapon and resisting an officer.
properties.Details: At approximately 08:38am officers responded to a report of a man with a gun in the 2100 block of Rosenberry.  An officer arrived and observed a subject fitting the descrption broadcast by dispatch.  The officer attempted to contact the subject and the subject fled on foot.  Officers pursued the suspect on foot to an apartment building in the 2100 block of Allied Drive.  Officers were able to determine what apartment the subject entered and made contact with the residents of the apartment.  They were ordered out of the apartment.The suspect was located hiding in the bathroom of the apartment.  A handgun was recovered from the apartment.  The Town Of Madison Police K-9 unit assisted Madison Police at the scene. Also arrested at the scene was Olivia L Lingston, 39 years old, of Magnolia Lane in Madison.  She was arrested for obstructing officers and she had an outstanding warrant for retail theft.

properties.Arrested: 16-year-old male, East High student.  Charges: Carrying a concealed weapon; Dangerous weapon other than firearm on school premises
properties.Details: At approx. 9:45 a.m., Madison police officers contacted the above suspect at East High School. THey discovered the juvenile was carrying concealed five razor blades. He was arrested on the above charges and conveyed to the Dane County Juvenile Reception Center.

properties.Arrested: LUKE T. GREBE, 24 years old, 500-blk of Dapin Rd.CHARGES: 1) Possession of a firearm by a felon; 2) Domestic Battery; 3) Domestic DC; 4) DC while armed
properties.Details: At approximately 5:44 p.m. on 10/20/05, Madison police responded to a report of a physical disturbance in the 500-blk of Dapin Rd.  According to the report the disturbance was occurring inside a residence.  Officers located witnesses who indicated the suspect had threatened people verbally, physically attacked someone and then armed himself with a knife while continuing to threaten people.  Witnesses also indicated they believed weapons were in the residence.  Officers secured the area and attempted at first, unsuccessfully, to make contact with the suspect.  Eventually, they located the suspect coming out of an adjacent unoccupied residence and were able to take him into custody without incident.  They arrested them on the above charges and conveyed him to the DAne County Jail.  A loaded weapon was located in the suspect's room.

properties.Arrested: Daniel Wedel, 20, Battery to a Police Animal
properties.Details: On 10/29/05 at approximately 12:30 a.m. a mounted police officer felt her horse "flinch" while working in the State St/Gorham area during the Halloween event.  Due to the copious amount of training this horse endured in preparation for crowd control/responses, the mounted officer thought it was unusual for the horse to flinch.  The officer turned and observed Wedel in what appeared to be another attempted to wind up and hit the horse with a cane.  When confronted, Wedel fled on foot and the officer gave chase.  Wedel climbed a metal fence near Gilman St and fell flat on his stomach on the other side.  The officer used Wedel's cane that he left behind and grabbed him with the cane around his suspenders.  Wedel fled again and broke his suspenders before running into another horse and falling to the ground.  Wedel was arrested for the aforementioned charge.

properties.Arrested: Brain Hale, 38, Madison:  Eluding, Reckless Driving, Resist/ObstructingVernell Henry, 37, Madison:  Resisting, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia
properties.Details: On 12/15/05 at approximately 8:15 p.m. members of the Madison Police Department's South/West Community Police Team (CPT) observed what appeared to be continuous short-term drug trafficking in south Madison. A suspect vehicle had left the observed area and started southbound on S. Park Street from Buick Street.  An officer attempted to stop the vehicle and brief pursuit began.  The vehicle continued southbound on S. Park St, weaving through a parking lot, and eventually entered the westbound ramp for the Beltline.  The pursuing officer estimated the suspect vehicle speed to be over 80 m.p.h. and terminated the pursuit.  Please note that the pursuit was terminated near the S. Park St. on-ramp to the westbound Beltline.  A short time later the same vehicle, which had previously been reported stolen, was found in the Allied Drive area where it had crashed into a ditch near Chalet Gardens.  Several officers responded to the scene as more information came in as to the driver and his whereabouts.  Two officers noticed Hale, the alleged driver, walking on Allied Drive and told him to stop.  Hale refused the uniformed officer's request to stop and led them on a footchase.  Hale hid behind thick bushes before finally being apprehended at 8:38 p.m.

properties.Arrested: Quadren L. Wilson, 21, Madison: Resisting an Officer (2 counts), Disorderly Conduct, Probation Hold, and unrelated warrants.
properties.Victim: Madison Police Officer injuries: abrasions to left arm, left wrist, left knuckles, right elbow, and knees. - treated and release from a local hospital.
properties.Details: On 12/23/2005 Madison Police responded to the Denny's Restaurant, located at 1798 Thierer Rd for a report of a person, later identified as Quandren L. Wilson, causing a disturbance inside the restaurant.  Officers arrived on scene and employees pointed out Wilson.  Officers were told Wilson refused to leave when asked after employees observed him harassing other customers.As officers attempted to speak with Wilson he ignored their instructions and attempted to leave the restaurant by physically pushing his way past two officers.  Wilson was able to get partially out of the restaurant, continued to struggle with officers and attempted to flee the scene.  Wilson continued to resist both officers’ attempts to take him into custody despite being repeat and clear instructions by the officers for Wilson to comply and to stop resisting.  Officers struggled with Wilson for approximately 5 minutes before additional officers were able to arrive on scene.  A Taser was deployed and officers were able to take Wilson into custody.  Wilson complained of chest pain and was transported to a local hospital where he was medically cleared.  Wilson was then booked into the Dane County Jail on the above charges.  The injured officer received numerous abrasions and bruises during the struggle with Wilson and was treated and release from a local hospital.

properties.Arrested: Joseph Durruthy, 21, Madison:  Carrying a Concealed Weapon, Bail Jumping, Operating with a Suspended Registration
properties.Details: On 1/8/06 at 10:59 p.m. numerous Madison Police Officers responded to 5618 Odana Rd for reports of shots being fired in the parking lot the "Green Room".  Officers learned through witness accounts that anywhere from five to 20 shots could have been fired as a result of this incident.  No injuries were reported.  After shots were fired, most involved fled on foot or in vehicles.  As officers were conducting their investigation Durruthy drove out of the Green Room parking lot at a high rate of speed.  Officers performed a traffic stop on his vehicle and during their investigation learned that Durruthy had a handgun in his vehicle.  Durruthy was arrested on the above charges and transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.  This incident remains under investigation by the Madison Police Department.

properties.Arrested: Steven Mundt, 51, No permanent addressMunicipal warrant, Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: The Madison Police Department has made an arrest in connection to the suspicious package found inside a federal mailbox on 1/11/06.  As previously released, the Dane County Sheriff’s Bomb Squad rendered this package safe.  The person in custody, on unrelated charges, has a local history of planting suspicious materials in the Madison area and he is believed to be responsible for the mailbox incident on W. Doty at Broom St.  The materials were fashioned in such a way that would lead investigators to believe to be suspicious in nature.  Due to the Bomb Squad’s training and experience, they determined that it needed to be rendered safe as all precautionary measures were taken.  After further analysis, it was learned that at this time, none of the three objects recovered on 1/11/06 were explosive in nature and not similar to the parking ramp pipe bombs.  Furthermore, it is believed that none of the objects found on 1/11/06 are connected to the comprehensive investigation surround the Dane County parking ramp pipe bombs.  At this point the investigation continues into the parking ramp pipe bombs.

properties.Arrested: Kimberly Crowley, 37, Madison:  Eluding, Probation Hold
properties.Details: On 1/26/05 at approximately 1:05 a.m. a Madison Police Officer ran a routine data check on a license plate.  The 2006 Ford Escape had a Ford Taurus license plate on it and the officer tried to initiate a traffic stop at the intersection of Schroeder Rd and S. Whitney Way.  In activating the overhead lights and siren, Crowley refused to stop and continued eastbound on the Beltline.  Tire deflation devices were placed on the eastbound Beltline at Hwy 51.  Crowley swerved and missed the device.  Crowley continued on the Beltline and proceeded northbound on I-90/94, with officers in pursuit.  Crowley exited at I-94 eastbound and proceeded for approximately 10 miles.  A Wisconsin State Trooper deployed tire deflation spikes and this time effectuated a stop.  The vehicle went down an embankment and Crowley fled on foot.  With the assistance of a Jefferson County K-9, Crowley was found and taken into custody at 2:50 a.m.  The entire pursuit was approximately 25 miles and lasted approximately 19 minutes.  Crowley was taken to the Dane County Jail without further incident.

properties.Arrested: Brian P. Smith,age 47, Fitchburg.  Charge: Bomb Threat,ss 947.015, currently in the Dane County Jail.
properties.Details: At approx. 9:06 a.m., Madison POlice responded to the report of a bomb threat at 1020 REgent St.  Because of the threat, the building was evacuated and staff searched the building looking for something suspicious.  Nothing was found.  Madison Police investigated and determined that an individual calling the bomb threat in was Brian P. Smith of FItchburg.  He was arrested in Fitchburg and conveyed to the  Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Rashard Walker, 29, Madison:  Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, Eluding, Resist/Obstructing an Officer, Disorderly Conduct, Numerous Dane County Warrants
properties.Details: On 2/22/06 at approximately 3:09 a.m. a Madison Police Officer noticed a stolen vehicle traveling eastbound on the Beltline.  The officer announced to other officers on the police radio that the officer was behind a stolen vehicle and would need assistance stopping it.  As the officer attempted to stop the vehicle, it fled traveling to the Kings Inn Motel, where the driver, Walker, fled on foot as officers gave chase.  A Madison Police Officer and K-9 also responded.  Walker fled and was pounding on a door to the motel to let him in.  Walker refused verbal commands and slightly gained entry into a room, where officers were unable to see his hand.  The K-9 officer gave the dog the "apprehension command" in which the dog ran up and bit Walker in the elbow area and did not let go.  Walker initially resisted the K-9 until the officer gave more verbal commands and eventually Walker sat down in front of the door.  Officers then handcuffed Walker without further incident.  Walker was taken to the hospital for routine check in which he had minor injuries/scratches and was released for jail.

properties.Arrested: Horatio Gardner, 21, Madison:  Possession of Firearm by a Felon, Carrying a Concealed Weapon, Resist/Obstructing an Officer x 2
properties.Details: On 2/22/06 at approximately 2 a.m. Madison Police Officers on patrol in the Allied Drive neighborhood came across a stalled vehicle at the corner of Lovell/Allied Drive.  In trying to contact people nearby for the investigation, Gardner saw police and immediately started running and ignored police commands to stop.  A foot pursuit ensued through the Allied Drive neighborhood.  Gardner was eventually tackled in a snow bank and taken into custody by Madison Police.  The officer who chased Gardner observed him throw an instrument into the snow during the foot chase.  That instrument ended up being a loaded firearm.  During the course of the struggled the Madison Police Officer hit the pavement and suffered minor injuries to the knee, thigh and elbow.  The officer went to a local hospital where the officer was treated and released.  Gardner was taken to the jail without further incident.

properties.Arrested: 16-yr old male resident of Sun Prairie, WIArrested and released to parent.Charges:  Possesssion with intent to deliver marijuana, Possess of cocaine, Possession of drug paraphernalia
properties.Details: At approximately 10:30 pm on 02/23/06, Madison Police responded to a report that someone had been jumped in the 300 block of N Walbridge.  Upon arrival, they contacted a 16-yr old male from Sun Prairie.  This juvenile told the officers that he had been jumped by 3 males.  The juvenile also told the officers that he had 2 friends with him at the time, and they had fled prior to police arrival.  Officers investigated and located drug paraphernalia, marijuana, and cocaine in the possession of the juvenile making the report.  They also noted that the subject had $800 in US currency on him.  The 16-yr old was charged with the above offenses and released to a parent.  Other details of the incident are not clear.

properties.Arrested: Steven Lopez-Ruiz, age 24, Madison resident. Charges: Second-degree sexual assault, robbery, and parole violation. Currently being held in the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Luke R Whetstone20 years of age6405 Fairhaven RdMadison, WI ;Eluding a Police Officer (3 counts)Operating after RevocationParole ViolationObstructing an OfficerDisorderly ConductTheftPossession of THC with Intent to DeliverPossession of Cocaine with Intent to DeliverPossession of Schedule 2 Narcotic with Intent to DeliverCurrently being held in Dane County Jail
properties.Address: Fish Hatchery Rd at Beltline Highway
properties.Details: At approx 10:27 am, an Officer in the area of Fish Hatchery Rd and the Beltline noted a vehicle operating at a high rate of speed on the shoulder of the road.  The Officer tried to stop the vehicle on Fish Hatchery Rd but was unable to do so.  The Officer broadcast a description of the vehicle and another Officer observed the vehicle inbound on Fish Hatchery Rd in the area of Wingra Dr.  When the second Officer tried to stop the vehicle it tried to elude him.  After a very short pursuit, the vehicle turned from Short St into an alley which was a dead end.  The driver exited the vehicle, ran towards a 12 ft fence, and climbed the fence.  He then ran through parking lots in the 1200 blk of Park St and crossed Park St. At this time he stopped running and gave up.  He then struggled with Officers as they tried to take him into custody.The driver was identified as the above arrested party.  He was found in the possession of controlled substances.  He was also wanted on two earlier eluding charges from incidents that occurred in the City of Madison.  Mr Whetstone was conveyed to the Madison Police Department and then to the Dane County Jail where he is currently being held.

properties.Arrested: KEVIN W WALLACE, 34 years old, Bultman Rd., MadisonCHARGE: Eluding an officer, operating after revocation, obstructing an officer, probation hold and two warrants.  Currently in the Dane County Jail
properties.Address: Commercial Av.  And N. Thompson Rd.
properties.Details: At approx. 11 a.m. on 03/07/06, an officer attempted to stop the above subject who was operating a vehicle with suspended registration.  The initial attempt occurred on Commercial near Thompson.  The vehicle fled and after a short pursuit, pulled into a parking lot in the 1600-blk of Bultman where the driver attempted to flee on foot.  The officer was able to contact the driver who resisted her attempts to take him into custody.  The officer used pepper spray and the  subject was taken into custody.  He currently is in the  Dane County Jail on the above charges.

properties.Arrested: Ursula S. Ahrens (25 year old female of Beaver Dam, WI)
properties.Victim: David M. Minahan (22 year old male of Madison )
properties.Details: On March 10th, 2006 at approximately 2:58a.m, Madison Police Officers responded to the 900 block of E. Dayton Street reference a person claiming to have almost been run over by a vehicle.  The victim David M. Minahan (22 year old male of Madison) stated he had been out with his friend/co-worker Ursula A. Ahrens (25 year old female of Beaver Dam, WI) at various bars in the Madison area when they both decided to come back to his residence for the evening.  Minahan knew that Ahrens had consumed alcohol on this date, and not only had he deemed himself the designated driver, but he also did not want Ahrens attempting to drive back to Beaver Dam.  An argument ensued between the two parties about the issue of driving, and Ahrens allegedly insisted on driving anyway.  Minahan happened to be in front of Ahrens vehicle when she decided to drive off and he was forced to jump on the hood of car; hanging on as tightly as he could so he would not fall off.  Minahan estimated the vehicle speeds to have reached 30mph, and he stated that the vehicle was traveling too fast for him to jump off safely.  The vehicle continued to drive on for several blocks (2/10ths of a mile) with Minahan hanging on to the hood of the car before the driver was forced to slow for crossing traffic.  This presented an opportunity for Minahan to jump safely from the hood of the car (performing a tuck and roll maneuver) and to contact the Madison Police Department to report the matter.Ahrens was stopped by the Madison Police Department in the 4800 block of American Parkway and arrested for 2nd Degree Reckless Endangering Safety and other alcohol/driving related charges.  While the Madison Police Department wants the public to be responsible in their choices to aid the community as a whole, we do not expect citizens to place themselves in harms way.  Please use caution when trying to deal with situations of this nature, and understand that the Madison Police Department offers its assistance in any matter of this nature.PO Howard Payne

properties.Arrested: Michael L. Frisch, 54 year old m/w of Madison
properties.Details: On March 18th, 2006, at approximately 7:19p.m, Madison Police were called to the 600 block of Buick Street reference a middle-aged male in possession of firearm on a Madison Metro Bus.  Multiple officers arrived on scene and approached the bus, contacting Michael L. Frisch at the rear of the bus.  Frisch, who was being pointed out by other patrons on the bus, was given directives by Police officers to keep his hands visible, but Frisch preceded to put his hands in his pocket.  Officers quickly moved in to place Frisch in custody and subsequently interviewed all parties involved.Several victims (15 & 16 year old African American Males) that were riding on the same bus accused Frisch of threatening them by his making mention of possessing a firearm.   Police searched Frisch and no weapon was found, but He readily admitted to having told the juveniles he had a gun!  Frisch allegedly exhibited threatening behavior by his use of racial epithets towards the two juveniles telling them to “Go back where you came from (Africa)”.  After Frisch was taken into custody, he continued to make racial slurs directed at an African American Police Officer that responded to the scene.Frisch was subsequently charged with Disorderly Conduct and a hate crime enhancer.  Frisch was taken to Detox with a blood alcohol level of .31 and Dane County Jail reference this incident and will have an opportunity in court to dispute all charges.PO Howard Payne

Officers were sent to a report of an assault that had taken place in the 200 block of King Street.  A woman was walking in this area when she was grabbed from behind by a male and assaulted.  The male suspect was still in the area when officers arrived.  He was arrested and is in custody at this time.  The investigation is on-going.

properties.Arrested: Jaime Lee Bole, age 21, resident of Monona.  Arrested in the city of Monona this morning by Madison police officers. CHARGES: Identity theft, 2 counts of obstructing an officer and 2 outstanding warrants for theft.  Currently in the Dane County Jail
properties.Victim: Adult resident of the state of Illinois
properties.Details: Madison police were recently contacted by an adult resident of the state of Illinois.  He indicated that he received a letter in the mail from the Madison Municipal Court indicating that he had been found guilty of a speeding violation.  The individual indicated that he had never received a speeding ticket in the city of Madison.  The officer that issued the initial citaton investigated the matter and found that in addition to the initial citation, another citation had been issued to an individual using the name of the person in Illinois.  The officer was able to identify the above-arrested party as the suspect and contacted him this morning in the city of Monona.  The subject was taken into custody by Madison officers and conveyed to the Dane Co. Jail.  It was also learned that the subject had two outstanding warrants for theft. The suspect is a relative of the Illinois resident.

properties.Arrested: 16 year-old male, Madison:  Eluding, Capias: Runaway, Hit and Run, Operating While Suspended, Imprudent speed
properties.Details: On 4/13 at approximately 11:14 a.m. the Madison Police Department's Traffic Enforcement Safety Team (TEST) was operating a speed wave on the eastbound Beltline.  An officer used laser to track one vehicle traveling 80 m.p.h.  As that vehicle was approaching, a second vehicle driven by the arrested 16 year-old passed the original vehicle traveling 80 m.p.h.  Both vehicles exited at Verona Rd and a Sergeant of MPD tried to contact both drivers. Verbal communication was made with both drivers and the 16 year-old eventually took off at a high rate of speed. The suspect vehicle traveled on the frontage road in front of Gino's Deli, where he went into the parking lot and hit an unoccupied vehicle.  The 16 year-old driver fled from the vehicle and was eventually tackled by citizens who held on to him until police arrived.

properties.Arrested: Aaron King (m/b, 12-21-88); charges:  disorderly conduct, obstrucing an officerTeshuna Dorsey (f/b, 3-25-78); charges:  disorderly conduct, resisting an officer
properties.Victim: Minor injuries to one MPD officer
properties.Details: On 4/17/06 MPD officers responded to the 2300 block of Allied Drive for a possible fight.  Arriving officers encountered about 40 subjects in the area.  As officers attempted to interview one of the participants, another subject attempted to intervene.  Officers then began to take that subject into custody, and a physical struggle ensued.  The officers were immediately surrounded by a crowd of about 25 hostile subjects, who prevented the officers from effecting the arrest.  A crowd of openly hostile individuals continued to gather. The officers requested assistance, and eventually more than 20 officers were required to control the disturbance..  Several arrests were made, and one MPD officer (who was pushed and scratched) sustained minor injuries during the incident.

properties.Arrested: Joshua Dancy: Armed RobberyMale, 15: Armed Robbery
properties.Details: The Madison Police Department has made two arrests in connection with several armed robberies.  Detectives noted that excellent eyewitness information, along with follow-up by on-scene officers helped in the arrest of Dancy and the juvenile.  This case remains open as more arrests are expected to be made and exact details are still being sorted out.  The following robberies can be linked to this overall case:4/8/06 Harley's Liquor on Atwood Ave, 4/15/06 Rocky's Liquor on Milwaukee St4/19/06 PDQ on Lien Rd, 4/21/06 Shell Gas on E. Washington, 4/22/06 Open Pantry on Pflaum Rd

properties.Arrested: Raymond Homme: Armed Robbery
properties.Details: On 5/4/06 at approximately 2:00 p.m. Madison Police Detectives received a tip that one of the suspects wanted in several local armed robberies was in a building in the 2300 block of Columbus Lane.  That person, Homme, was viewed in the building.  Because Homme is a suspect in armed robberies, it was unknown if he was currently carrying any weapons.  Also, detectives heard small children inside the living unit.  Precautions were made and the Madison Police Department's Emergency Response Team deployed.  Eventually phone negotiations were made with Homme, who was originally uncooperative.  The situation was resolved around 5:30 p.m. through negotiations and Homme was taken into custody without incident.

properties.Arrested: De'Amate A. Williams, 21 year old of Madison WI --  Charges: Attempted Armed Robbery 943.32(2)/939.62 & Disorderly Conduct While Armed 947.01/939.63(1)(a)
properties.Details: On 5/4/06 at approximately 11:21p.m., The Madison Police Department responded to an armed robbery, which allegedly occurred outside of the Open Pantry on Pflaum Road.  Upon arrival, a very observant officer had noticed the suspect (Williams) in the area just minutes before the robbery attempt.  The officer described Williams as "Looking into the police car in a menacing way" as Williams walked near the Open Pantry Convenience Store.  Minutes later, a 25 year old victim would be walking to a friends house near Pflaum Road and Camden Road.   Williams would confront the victim near this intersection demanding everything in his pockets.  The victim thought Williams was holding a silver colored gun underneath his shirt when the request for his property was made.  Williams then proceeds to head butt the victim after the victim stated he had nothing in his pockets.  As the victim fled the attempted robbery scene, he continued running back to the Open Pantry Store for assistance/refuge!  Williams chased the victim until he neared the store entrance, and was not seen again until police would contact him at his residence just a few short blocks away.An observant officer, with timely information about individuals in the area, led to an arrest in this situation.  The victim was not injured and lost no property whatsoever.  Officers were extremely efficient in their efforts, and this work reiterates the importance of community involvement; building bridges that ensures our city remains safe at all times.

properties.Arrested: 34 yr old male resident of Madison.  At this time, the subject is being conveyed to the Mendota Mental Health Institute.  He faces possible criminal charges of battery (2 counts), disorderly conduct (2 counts), criminal damage to property, intimidation of a victim, and attemtping to disarm a police officer.
properties.Victim: One citizen was struck in the face and then pulled off a bicycle.  A second citizen had his glasses pulled off and destroyed.  Three officers received minor injuries.  Two officers were treated at a local hospital;  the third officer indicated he did not need medical follow-up.
properties.Details: At approximately 9:26 am, officers responded to the 10 block of N Dickinson St reference a disturbance.  Upon arrival, they contacted the 2 victims noted above.  The first victim told officers when he pulled into a parking lot, a subject came up to his car, pounded on the windshield, and spit on the car.  The second victim indicated that he was riding his bicycle by the incident when the subject approached him and punched him in the face.  The bicyclist tried to ride away and the subject pursued him and pulled him from the bike.  The bicyclist was injured (leg injury) at this point.  The subject then approached the first victim, grabbed his glasses off his face and damaged them. At this point, the subject walked away on foot.  He was located by Madison officers several blocks away on Dayton St.  Officers attemtpted to take him into custody and he began fighting with the officers.  The subject attemtpted to take one of the officers' firearm.  A retired Madison officer driving by at the time stopped to help restrain the subject.  The officers were injured during this part of the altercation.The subject,  uninjured, was conveyed to an hospital emergency room for evaluation.  At this time, subject is being conveyed to the Mendota Mental Health Institute.

properties.Arrested: Four students werer arrested, one non-student was arrested.One 14-yr old was arrested for disorderly conduct; one 15-yr old was arrested for disorderly conduct; a 16-yr old was arrested for disorderly conduct; an 18-yr old was arrested for disorderly conduct; a non-student was arrest for disorderly conduct and trespassing.All were cited and released except the 16-yr old, who was conveyed to Juvenile Reception Center.
properties.Details: At approximately 11 am, Madison police responded to the cafeteria at Memorial High School regarding a fight in progress.  The five individuals listed above were arrested.  Investigation showed that the fight started between 2 of the students, and that 2 other students took sides and joined in.  After the 4 had been separated and taken into custody, the non-student showed up at the school and caused a disturbance.

properties.Arrested: Christopher Webb, 20, Ohio.  Homicide warrant from OhioJoann Hill, 27, Madison:  Probation Hold/Obstructing
properties.Details: On 5/18/06 at approximately 10:00 p.m. several Madison Police Officers captured Webb who was wanted for extradition on a homicide warrant out of Ohio.  Officers had learned of Webb being in Madison and investigated leads to find out his location.  A perimeter was set up around a home on Moorland Rd.  Webb walked away from the home with Hill and was contacted by an officer following on foot.  Upon contact, both Webb and Hill were untruthful about his identity.  A photograph from Ohio eventually confirmed Hill was wanted for homicide.  He was taken into custody without incident.

properties.Arrested: Minj-Jen Chen, age 28, resident of MadisonCharges:  Eluding an officer, speeding, recklessly endangering safety
properties.Details: At approximately 1:50 pm this date, a Madison Police Officer was running radar in the 100 block of S Whitney Way.  He attempted to stop a southbound vehicle.  The vehicle accelerated away from the officer and a short pursuit followed.  The vehicle traveled on Sheboygan Ave. and Eau Claire Ave. before heading westbound on Old Middleton Rd.  The driver pulled into a parking lot of the 5000 block of Old Middleton Rd. and was taken into custody.  As he pulled in to the parking lot he came extremely close to pedestrians including one with a baby.  The driver is currently in the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Robert J. Thomas, 40 years old, no permanent address, charged with Burglary and Possession of Burglary Tools.  Currently in the Dane County Jail.
properties.Details: Madison Police took a report of an overnight burglary in the 300 block of West Wilson St. this morning. At approximately 10:40 am, Madison Police learned that the University of Wisconsin Police had contacted the above subject near the State St. mall.  The University Police noticed the subject was in possession of a several expensive items.  These items were determined to have been stolen from a residence in the 300 block of W. Wilson.

properties.Arrested: David Reilly, 30, Madison: warrant for 1st degree Reckless Homicide, Parole apprehension request, pending traffic charges
properties.Details: On 5/31/06 at 11:30 a.m. Madison Police spotted Reilly in a vehicle on Vernon Ave.  An initial traffic stop of Reilly was unsuccessful and he lead Madison Police and eventually the Dane County Sheriff's Office, Wisconsin State Patrol, DeForest Police and Sun Prairie Police on a high speed chase that lasted approximately 30 minutes.  During the pursuit, speeds reached 100 m.p.h. and went though the eastern and northeastern parts of Dane County.  Road spikes were deployed and eventually Reilly drove over them causing his tires to deflate.  He continued to operate his vehicle at a lower rate of speed until he was boxed in by police squad cars and then gave up without further incident.  Prior to today's contact, Madison Detectives tried to have Reilly cooperate several times throughout the last few months and turn himself in.

properties.Arrested: Gregory B. Flowers,age 30 Madison,Wi., charged with Operating a Motor Vehicle While Under the Influence, Sixth Offense; Operating After Revocation, Hit and Run, and Obstructing an Officer. Currently being held in the Dane County Jail.
properties.Details: Approximately 5:21 am, Madison Police responded to S. Stoughton Rd. at Pflaum Rd. reference a vehicle that had gone off the road.  Officers arrived and determined that the driver of the involved vehicle had fled the scene on foot. The above suspect was located in the area.  Officers determined that the suspect above was driving a borrowed car when he went off the road and struck a tree.  The subject was arrested by Madison officers on the above charges.  No further information available at this time.

properties.Arrested: Noah Cornelius, 27, Madison & Minnesota:  Lewd & Lacivious, Battery, Possession of THC.
properties.Address: 10 blk of E. Johnson and 1000 block of E. Johnson
properties.Details: On 5/29/06 from 2:50 a.m. to 3:47 a.m. the same Madison Police Officer took two separate reports of females being approached by an unknown subject.  In the first instance, a female was walking at 2:52 a.m. in the 700 block of E. Johnson and noticed a male following her on foot.  This continued for three blocks until she was confronted.  The male blocked her path and wouldn't let her leave.  The female punched the unknown subject in an attempt to flee.  The male subject grabbed the female and battered her until she screamed.  The suspect fled.  A short time later, around 3:47 a.m. a suspect approached a different female in the 10 block of E. Johnson in which he exposed himself from his van.  The female, walking on the sidewalk, continued to walk away.  The male subject got out of his vehicle and again approached the female exposing himself.  The male subject fled as the female victim screamed.  In obtaining these reports, officers and a detective gathered more information as to a lead on a suspect.  On 6/19/06 Cornelius was arrested on the above charges.

properties.Arrested: Lonnie Reed, male, 17, Madison: OMVWOC, Carrying a Concealed Weapon, Arterial Stop Violation, Duty Upon Striking an Attended Vehicle, Operating After Suspension, Failure to Obey Officer's Signal, Resisting Arrest
properties.Details: On 6/20/06 at approximately 1:00 a.m. a Madison Police Officer on routine patrol observed a vehicle travel through the stop signs at the intersection of N. Patterson and E. Mifflin St.  The officer initiated a traffic stop on E. Johnson.  The vehicle stopped and everyone inside fled on foot.  The officer did not chase the fleeing people because the officer noticed the vehicle was not placed in park and was now rolling toward the squad car.  The vehicle crashed into the squad car causing minor damage.  The officer did radio to other officers the suspect descriptions.  A short time later other officers observed Reed on Sherman Ave and made contact.  Reed was subsequently arrested and transported to the Dane County Jail. A K-9 search of the area did not locate the other suspects.  The vehicle the occupants were in was stolen from the City of Middleton.

properties.Arrested: Jay S. Nickelson, age 27, Madison, WICharges: Operating While Intoxicated and Eluding Officer         Currently in the Dane County Jail
properties.Details: At approximately 1:20 a.m. on 6/29/06, a Madison Police Officer observed a vehicle speeding on the W. Beltline Hwy.  The officer noted the vehicle was going approximately 85 mph and changing lanes recklessly.  The officer attempted to stop the vehicle in the area of Todd Dr. and the Beltline, and the vehicle continued on westbound.  The vehicle exited the Beltline at the Verona Rd. exit at a high rate of speed, narrowly missing a second Madison squad car.  The suspect vehicle struck a vehicle as it swerved around the second squad car.  It appeared that this caused minor damage.  The vehicle continued on to the 2200 block of Carling Dr. where it entered a parking lot.  It was going fast enough at this point that it left the ground when it entered the parking lot.  Once in the parking lot, the driver exited his vehicle, gave up, and became cooperative.  He was taken into custody and charged with the above offenses.Mr. Nickelson  is currently in the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Male, age 19, Madison, WICharge: Burglary and Resisting an OfficerA second suspect remains at large

The above arrested subject was taken into custody several blocks from the school.  The other suspect is still at large at this time.  No damage was noted in the school.  Several items appeared to have been taken from the school.  The value of these items appears to be insignificant.

properties.Arrested: Louis James Thornton

A track was initiated and Thornton was apprehended a short time later.  Thornton had several outstanding warrants for his arrest including an escape warrant and several traffic warrants.  He was also charged with resisting and operating after revocation reference this incident.

properties.Arrested: Louis J. Thornton (M/B, age: 43)  Charges:  1) Resisting/obstructing an officer; 2) Warrant for Escape;  3)  Warrant for operating after revocation

properties.Arrested: Brian M. Gehn, age 24, resident of Madison. Charged: Operating while intoxicated, 3rd offense, reckless driving, and inattentive driving. Released to responsible party.

properties.Arrested: 19-year-old female resident of Linden Station, Wisconsin. Charges: Abandonment of child.
properties.Victim: 2-year-old male child. Placed by Dane County Human Services with an adult relative.
properties.Details: At approximately 10:00 a.m. on 06/30/2006, Madison police responded to a call in the 900 block of Lake Court reference a child whose mother had not returned to get him after approximately 20 hours.  The child had been left at the residence at approximately 2:00 p.m. on 06/29/2006.  The residence was occupied by adults.  Although the adults were not asked if they would care for the child, they assumed responsibility for the child and cared for the child overnight.  By 10:00 a.m. on 06/30/2006, the mother still had not returned to pick up the child and Social Services was called.  They in turn notified the Madison Police Department.  The child had been left for approximately 20 hours. At approximately 11:00 a.m. on 06/30/2006, the mother returned to Lake Court to pick up her son.  She was contacted by Madison Police and arrested on the above charge.

properties.Arrested: Matthew J. Finn, age 19, Madison, WIJohn P. Lusis, age 19, Madison, WI Both charged with graffiti and underage drinking.

Upon arrival, they located the above 2 arrested subjects.  After investigating the incident, the 2 subjects were arrested on the above charges.  It appears that 3 buildings in the area were subject of graffiti damage as well as 2 vehicles.  Both subjects are currently in the Dane County Jail.  The buildings involved belong to the State of Wisconsin, the City of Madison, and Madison Gas & Electric.

properties.Arrested: (1) Allen Crawford Jr. of Fitchburg, WI- Charges: Substantial Battery, Probation Violation, Disorderly Conduct (2) Barrett R. Locatelli of Madison, WI - Charges: Substantial Battery, Criminal Damage To Property, & Disorderly Conduct.
properties.Address: 400 Blk of State Street, Madison WI
properties.Victim: 24 year old male of Lake Mills Wisconsin
properties.Details: Madison Police were called to the 400 blk of State Street at approximately 11:25pm on 6/30/06 reference a disturbance at that location.  Police would soon find a 24-year-old male in need of medical attention due to having sustained severe facial lacerations and profuse bleeding.  This victim was allegedly attempting to deescalate a disturbance involving the two suspects listed above and a third unidentified person who was being chased.  When the victim intervened he became the focus of the violent behavior and was subsequently battered.It was reported to police that two suspects (later identified as Locatelli and Crawford Jr.) had both kicked and punched the victim several times to the head.  This victim was said to have lost consciousness and would be later taken to UW Hospital for treatment.  A window at a nearby establishment was broken leading up to the substantial battery and it is still unclear as to why/how the damage to property is connected to this scenario.Based on specific descriptions of the suspects, Police would soon located Locatelli and Crawford Jr. a short distance away and they were arrested based on identifications by witnesses of their alleged involvement.  The victim in this scenario was attempting to be a "Good Samaritan", but that did put him in a bad predicament.  We are asking people to not physically involve themselves in situations such as this and to call the police to report information that they may have of any crime that has transpired.PO Howard Payne

properties.Arrested: Male, 38, Mosinee, WI:  Disorderly Conduct, Resisting Arrest, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia
properties.Details: On 7/11/06 at approximately 7:01 a.m. Madison Police Officers responded to a disturbance at the Excel Inn at 4202 East Towne Blvd.  Officers responded to a person "freaking out" and causing a disturbance, while unclothed, in the hallway.  The first responding officer reports that upon arrival the individual was compliant and sitting down in the hallway in just his underwear.  Before back-up officers arrived, the suspect became violent in pounding his body against the wall and eventually approached the sole officer.  That officer deployed the taser to the individual in which it gained momentary compliance.  The suspect continued chanting, encouraged pain, continued injuring himself and made aggressive moves toward that officer.  As another officer responded, the taser was deployed again and an officer went "hands on" to try and handcuff him.  The suspect struggled and other taser deployments occurred.  As more officers responded, the suspect was eventually arrested on the above charges.  Madison Police Officers recently went through in-depth training on "excited delirium" in which suspects who are naked oftentimes are on a drug high in which they feel extreme heat in which nothing can cool them off and where they seem immune to any pain they may inflict on themselves.  Responding to a police call with naked individuals, acting violently, can be an extremely dangerous situation.

properties.Arrested: David D. Kelm, age 42, Madison, WICharge:  Operating a Motor Vehicle While Intoxicated, 5th Offense

Dickinson St.  It was reported that a vehicle had struck a street sign.  Officers responded to the area and located the suspect vehicle . properties.Arrested: Wensy Melendez, 23, Madison:  Battery-2 counts, Disorderly Conduct-2 counts
properties.Victim: Female, Hispanic, 21Female, Hispanic, 19both suffered minor injuries
properties.Details: On 8/20/06 at approximately 2:30 a.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the 1400 block of University Ave for a large disturbance.  It was learned that the two victims were in a fight, after bar-time, with some other females, which eventually ended.  Melendez who had a relative in the original fight, was told of the fight and showed up on scene.  Melendez confronted two females and punched them in the face, as he wanted to protect his relative.  While officers made the arrest of Melendez, several more vehicles came to the parking lot to confront him.  Officers had to calm those that wanted to fight Melendez for punching females.

properties.Arrested: Fredy Xicay-Garcia, 28, Madison:  Child Enticement
properties.Details: On 8/27/06 at approximately 7:00 p.m. a Madison Police Officer was on routine patrol when the victim in an attempted child enticement flagged down the officer.  The officer learned that the female was with another female friend at the Mobil Gas station on Hughes/Park St when Xicay-Garcia drove by in his white SUV.  Xicay-Garcia got out of the vehicle and tried to verbally engage the victim into getting into his vehicle.  The victim and friend walked away.  Xicay-Garcia then drove by the females, again trying to get the victim into his car verbally.  Xicay-Garcia then drove ahead and parked his vehicle to watch the girls.  The girls went to the play area of Lincoln school.  Xicay-Garcia moved his vehicle and parked to watch the girls play.  Xicay-Garcia then circled the school at least four times watching the girls.  The girls became fearful and contacted a male friend, 11, who confronted Xicay-Garcia who was now in the school parking lot.  Fortunately nothing happened to the 11 year-old boy upon confrontation, but Xicay-Garcia told the boy that he loved the victim.  The boy informed this to the girls, who were now afraid.  They noticed the police officer, gave a description and the officer saw the vehicle shortly after.  Xicay-Garcia was arrested without incident.

properties.Arrested: Patrick Okopinski, 37, Sun Prairie:  Possession of Child Pornography, 26 counts
properties.Details: On 8/28/06 at approximately 5 p.m. Madison Police Officers went to All-Star Gymnastics to arrest Okopinski for Possession of Child Pornography (26 counts) on his business and personal computer.  Okopinski is the owner of All-Star Gymnastics, located on Walsh Rd.  As part of a separate investigation involving a former employee of Okopinski’s, detectives learned that Okopinski did have child pornography on his computer.  Through the course of interviews, Okopinski told investigators that he gained sexual gratification in viewing child pornography while in the workplace.  Okopinski was arrested while at his workplace without incident.

properties.Arrested: COURTNEY L. MILLLER, 27 YEARS OLD, MADISON, WICHARGES: 2ND-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety.Currently in the Dane Co. Jail
properties.Victim: Adult Female driver, minor injuries; did not seek medical attention.
properties.Details: At approx. 8:19 a.m., this date, Madison Police received reports of two vehicles racing inbound on Gorham St.  Officers received five reports of racing and reckless driving on the part of two drivers.  Witness statements indicated the vehicles were traveling in excess of 60 mph in heavy traffic.  At the intersection of Franklin and Gorham, one vehicle ran the red light and crashed into a vehicle that was turning from Franklin onto Gorham.  The driver of the vehicle that ran the red light is identified as the arrested person listed above.  He received minor injuries.  The driver of the vehicle he hit received minor injuries.  No one sought medical attention.  Both vehicles were totaled.  The suspect vehicle was a 1987 CAdillac.  The vehicle that was struck was a 2000 Subaru.  In addition to the charge noted above, Miller received traffic citations for operating with a suspended DL, operating with suspended registration, a red signal violation and racing. A passenger in the suspect vehicle fled on foot and has not been located at this time.  The second vehicle involved in the racing is identified as a black Chevy Caprice.  That vehicle has not been located.  Anyone with information about this case should call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014 .

properties.Arrested: Antonio Martinez, 38, Madison:  First Deg Reckless Endangering Safety, Attempted Armed Robbery, Criminal Damage to Property, Resisting a Police Officer
properties.Victim: Female, 37, Stoughton, no injuries. Female, 24, Madison, minor injuries.
properties.Details: On 9/27/06 at approximately 12:14 a.m. a Madison Police Officer was flagged down by a victim in this incident.  The officer learned that the two victims were in a vehicle behind the 2300 block of Cypress Way when Martinez approached them.  He asked for a cigarette and as the driver reached for one, he grabbed her in a headlock and dragged her outside demanding money and displaying a knife.  The victim broke free, while the passenger honked the horn and tried to role up the windown.  The passenger moved into the driver's seat to attempt to flee.  Martinez pounded on the window and eventually stabbed the vehicle's tire.  The original driver had fled the area on foot. The new driver also fled and found the police officer to report this to.  Through information learned during the investigation, officers were able to arrest Martinez.  While transporting Martinez to the jail, he attempted to kick out the squad car's window and was disruptive.

properties.Arrested: Male, 12, 6th grade, Madison: Disorderly COnduct.  Arrested, released to parent.

The juvenile was charged and released to a parent.

properties.Arrested: Daniel J. Latzke, age 27, Waukesha, Wisconsin, charges first offense operating while intoxicated and second-degree recklessly endangering safety
properties.Victim: Adult males, one from Oregon, Wisconsin and the other from Belleville, Wisconsin
properties.Details: At approximately 2:51 am this date, Madison officers noted a disturbance at the intersection of Randall and Regent St.  It appeared that some of the parties involved were associated with a vehicle while the others were pedestrians.  Officers investigated and learned that words were exchanged between the two groups possibly related to pedestrians walking in front of an automobile.  One of the passengers of the automobile exited and confronted the pedestrians.  The driver of the automobile was identified as Daniel Latzke.  The victims indicate that the driver drove the vehicle intentionally at them, coming close enough to run over someone's foot.  Mr. Latzke was arrested on the above charges and is currently in the Dane County Jail.

Ware, age 18, Fitchburg, Wisconsin, charged with party to the crime of carrying a concealed weapon, possession with intent to deliver marijuana, possession of cocaine, currently in Dane County Jail

properties.Arrested: Joshua L. Wilburn; 28 years of age; charges:  Domestic Battery; Domestic Disorderly Conduct (while armed); Domestic Criminal Damage to Property
properties.Victim: 23 year old female with minor injuries (not requiring medical attention)
properties.Details: On 10/27/06 shortly after midnight, officers responded to an address in the 600 block of South Segore Road for a domestic problem.  As the first officer arrived, he observed Wilburn sitting on a couch inside the residence.  Wilburn was armed with a large hunting knife at the time.  Wilburn was holding the knife a few inches from his chest.  The officer ordered Wilburn to drop the knife; Wilburn did not do so, but instead started to move the knife towards his chest.  The officer deployed his Taser, which incapacitated Wilburn before he could injure himself or others.  Wilburn was then taken into custody.

properties.Arrested: Larry Rolack, 18, Middleton: Theft-Party to a Crime-PTAC, Entry into a locked vehicle-PTAC, Criminal Damage to Property-PTACMale, 16, Madison: Theft-PTAC, Entry into a locked vehicle-PTAC, Criminal Damage to Property-PTACSuspect #3, driver, male, black
properties.Details: On 11/23/06 at approximately 9:58 p.m. two Madison Police Officers were in the vicinity of the Dutch Mill Park & Ride (Stoughton Rd & Beltline) and heard a car alarm go off.  The officers responded to the Park & Ride witnessing a vehicle, with three people inside, fleeing the parking lot at a high rate of speed.  The officers followed the vehicle onto Dutch Mill Rd, with lights and siren activated.  The vehicle stopped at Progress Rd and the driver fled on foot and is still wanted by police.  The other two suspects were ordered in their vehicle, remained and were arrested on the charges listed above.  It was learned that the individuals were looking for "licks", stealing valuables from vehicles, and had broken into two that evening alone.

Chaney was eventually brought into custody behind a building at Fahrenbrook/Mills St.  Smith stayed in the vehicle that she owned and was charged for having a makeshift club under her seat.

properties.Arrested: Antonio Muniz, 18, McFarland:  Eluding, Resisting, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Operating While Revoked and a number of traffic citations. properties.Details: On 1/7/07 at approximately 3:46 a.m. a Madison Police Officer observed a vehicle travel through a red light on Wisconsin Ave.  In an effort to catch up to this vehicle the officer observed other traffic violations and a sharp increase in speed by the driver (later identified as Muniz).  The officer, with lights and siren activated, pursued Muniz and the several occupants.  Included in the streets of the pursuit were Carroll St. W. Dayton, Fairchild, W. Main, Proudfit and Brittingham Place.  Speeds were estimated to be approximately 50-55 m.p.h.   On North Shore the vehicle crossed both lanes of traffic and stopped on the curb.  As officers approached, Muniz fled the vehicle on foot and left the teenage passengers in the car.  Muniz was later apprehended without incident at the bus depot on Bedford St.

properties.Arrested: Albert Amos, 32, Madison:  Possession with Intent to Deliver (THC), Felony parole warrant(Featured on Madison's Most Wanted)
properties.Details: On 1/24/07 at approximately 8:50 p.m. the Madison Police Department's West Community Police Team (CPT) arrested Albert Amos at a residence in the 3200 block of Prairie Rd.  Officers set up on the residence hoping to spot Amos and effectuate an arrest.  Amos was in the garage when confronted by officers, including K-9 Johnny.  Amos ran back into the residence.  Officers, in hot pursuit of a felon, chased Amos into the house where he was arrested. The investigation led to the capture of drugs, sales equipment and a cash supply.

properties.Arrested: Maurice D. Harris (m/b, 38 years of age); charges: 1) Parole Violation; 2) Eluding an Officer; 3) Resisting an Officer; 4) Warrants (OMVWI & Speeding); 5) Numerous Traffic Violations
properties.Details: On 2/4/07 at about 3:12 am two MPD officers attempted to contact a subject in a vehicle in a parking lot on Crescent Road.  As the officers approached, the subject abruptly pulled away, strking another vehicle in the lot.  The officers pursued and attempted to stop the car.  The driver refused to stop and accelerated in an attempt to flee from the officers.  After a short pursuit, the vehicle struck a tree on Seminole Highway and the driver fled on foot.An MPD K9 unit responded, and K9 Gildon tracked the suspect from the scene of the crash.  Harris was located hiding in some bushes and taken into custody without incident.

properties.Arrested: Jason Eisele, 20, Madison: Underage Drinking, ResistingAnthony Bormett, 20, Madison: Underage Drinking, Resisting
properties.Details: On 2/4/07 at 2:50 a.m. two Madison Police Officers responded to a loud house party in the 2600 block of North Ct.  Officers noted this to be an on-going problem home for underage house parties.  Upon exiting their squad cars, the officers noted the windows to the house were thumping due to the loud music/bass.  The officers knocked at the door and eventually a female answered, saw it was the police, and immediately closed the door-announcing police arrived.  Eisele eventually came to the door and did not allow officers inside, nor did he step outside.  Officers spoke to Eisele through the approximate 12 inch door opening that he was willing to converse through.  Through the conversation, Eisele continuously ashed his cigarette through the door crack near the officers.  Upon gaining probable cause for an arrest, officers grabbed Eisele's arm as he ashed his cigarette.  Eisele resisted and a friend inside pushed against the door in an attempt to free Eisele and prevent officers from making an arrest.  Eventually officers dynamically entered the door and confronted a resistive Eisele and Bormett.  The actively resisting suspects were decentralized and arrested.  During this process a German shepherd entered the area from within the house and bit an officer in the knee area.  More officers responded and Eisele and Bormett were arrested.  Other juveniles were cited at the party for underage alcohol consumption.  Eisele and Bormett were transported to the Dane County Jail.

This afternoon Madison Police West District Community Police Team (CPT) was contacting the driver of a vehicle during the course of an investigation. During the contact a Madison Police Officer was injured by the motor vehicle  as the operator attempted to flee. The officer was transported to a local hospital where he was treated for injuries and released. Investigation is continuing.

properties.Arrested: Moshea R. Norris  m/b  08-25-84Martell A. Norris  m/b  02-21-81Octavion G. Thomas  m/b 08-26-86

Subjects were charged with Resisting/Obstructing.

properties.Arrested: Terrance Buchanan, 19, Madison:  Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, Resisting arrest, Probation Hold
properties.Details: On 2/26/07 around 3 p.m. a citizen noticed that his stolen auto from the previous day was traveling northbound on Whitney Way and notified 911.  Officers located the vehicle in the 600 block of N. Whitney in a parking lot and attempted to stop it.  Buchanan fled from the vehicle.  Officers pursued Buchanan on foot and were yelling for him to stop.  A citizen walking out of a store noticed the foot pursuit and as Buchanan ran by, the citizen tripped him with his foot. The pursuing officer wanted to prevent Buchanan from standing up and decentralized the suspect.  While decentralizing the suspect, the officer broke a wrist in which the officer was treated and released from a local hospital.

properties.Arrested: Christopher Coster, 34, Madison:  Armed Robbery, 4 other warrants
properties.Details: On 2/28/07 the Amcore Bank was robbed on E. Washington Ave.  Please see a previous news release.  Outstanding photos of the suspect were made public and information was gathered on who he was.  Patrol officers were given suspect information and on 3/1/07 the suspect’s vehicle was located at a residence on E. Washington Ave.  A perimeter was set up around the house and numerous attempts to make contact with the suspect inside failed.  Officers exhausted reasonable means to contact Coster, as they had reason to believe he was inside.  A contingent of on-duty Emergency Response Team personnel was assembled.  The team entered through the front door and apprehended Costo immediately, without further incident.  Coster is in the Dane County Jail.  The success of this bank robber arrest is credited to a number of officers.  It should be noted the excellent quality of the bank photos.  After other bank robbery photos were only showing the tops of suspects heads, or were of worse quality, MPD suggested altering the angle of the camera and upgrading the quality to several banks.  Amcore followed our suggestions and the photos taken were very helpful in identifying Coster.
