One of the perpetrators inquired about the victim's gang affiliation. The victim said he was not in a gang. One of the foursome pulled a BB gun and pointed it at the teen. He (the victim) put out his hand to defend himself, and was shot in that hand. He went to a local hospital to have the BB removed.

South District officers responded to several reports of shots fired overnight. In at least one case officers did find evidence of actual gunfire.At 3:17 a.m. on the 24th officers rolled up on the 2900 block of Traceway Drive and recovered a shotgun shell casing, and four shell wads in the street. There were also a few drops of what appeared to be blood. However, no one was found to be shot. A canvass of the neighborhood revealed there had been a party at a nearby residence, and several vehicles were reported leaving the area following the shotgun blasts.On the 23rd, at about quarter-of-nine, residents reported hearing "shots" coming from the area of the Penn Park pavilion, 2101 Fisher Street, where some children/young people had been hanging out. No evidence of weapons being discharged was found, and it's possible the "shots" were actually fireworks.Twenty minutes, or so, later several officers were dispatched to the 900 block of Magnolia Lane after a citizen reported hearing several rounds. The caller said the “shots” were followed by yelling, and the sounds of "kids" running.

properties.Suspect: Matthew F. Thorson, age 26, Bloomington MNMr. Thorson was arrested and tentatively charged with Carrying a Concealed Weapon
properties.Details: On Sunday morning, around 12:45 a.m., Madison police were called to the Angelic Brewery after witnesses reported seeing a man with a knife. The suspect told police he had pulled it out earlier during a dispute over waiting in line to get into the brewery. He said he realized that was not a smart thing to do. Some who witnessed the knife became scared and left the bar after he entered it. Mr. Thorson had the weapon in a front pocket. It is described as a nine-inch folding knife. It was housed in a black leather sheath.

Several callers reported numerous shots fired in the area.  Responding officers found casings in the street but all involved parties had left the area.  No victims were contacted and there were no indications that anyone was injured, nor any vehicles or building struck.  Investigation continuing.

Early Thursday morning, around 12:35 a.m., several Madison residents reported hearing gunshots. The citizen callers informed Dane County 911 dispatchers that they thought the reports had come from the 5700 block of Raymond Road. Some said it sounded like four rapid shots, and one caller reported hearing a car slow down just prior to the noise. Responding officers were unable to find shell casings or other evidence.

properties.Suspect: Adam P. Vanspankeren, age 20, MadisonMr. Vanspankeren was arrested and tentatively charged with First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, and Carrying a Concealed Weapon.
properties.Victim: Male, age 20, Boston MAVictim suffered a neck cut that required several stitches.Female, age 20, MadisonVictim suffered a cut to her arm, which also required a few stitches.
properties.Details: Shortly after 11:00 p.m. on Thursday night Madison Police responded to a residence on North Murray Street after two people were cut with a small knife. The female victim says she was watching TV with the suspect and the male victim when the male victim started touching and bothering her. She is friends with the suspect, but had just met the male victim. As he began to annoy her she asked the suspect to do something about it. She was shocked when the suspect decided to intervene by retrieving a small knife. The suspect cut the male victim on the neck, and accidentally did the same to the female victim's arm.

properties.Address: 700 block of State Street (UPDATED MONDAY JUNE 2, 2008)
properties.Victim: Jason H. Lawler, m/w, 26. Senior at UW.
properties.Details: (UPDATED INFORMATION)On Sunday evening, June 1, 2008, around 10:12 p.m. a 24-year-old man from Madison came to the Central District of the Madison Police Department (City County Building) to talk with officers about the stabbing. The man said he was the one who stabbed the victim, but only after the victim, and the victim’s friend attacked him. A detective has been assigned the case and is in the process of ferreting out the truth. At this time no arrests have been made.(ORIGINAL RELEASE)Lawler was walking with a friend when they were confronted by the suspect. A verbal altercation ensued at which the suspect produced a sharp instrument and proceeded to stab Lawler in the lower left side of his back and left elbow. Lawler is being treated at a local hospital and is stable condition. His injuries do not appear to be life threatening.

properties.Suspect: Jessi L. Swenson, 33
properties.Details: Swenson became highly upset  after getting into an altercation with the victim whom she believed was refusing to turn over some proeprty which belonged to her. Swenson then armed herself with a hunting knife which belonged to the victim and proceeded to stab at him several times. The victim took cover behind his bedroom door until Swenson dropped the knife at which time the victim pushed her out of the residence. Swenson was utlimately charged with First degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, OMVWI, Battery, and Criminal Damage to Property.

A resident who lives in the 2000 block of Baird Street reported a storm door had been struck by a bullet Monday night shortly after 8:30 p.m. The slug stuck in the home's wooden front door. The caller observed several people running away from Penn Park at the time the shot rang out.Earlier, at 8:10 p.m., two other callers reported hearing gunfire coming from the park, and seeing people running. One thought they heard five shots, the other three; however, in retrospect, the second of the initial callers thought the "bangs" could have been fireworks.

properties.Details: Residents who live near Penn Park, and Madison Police Department South District officers have been concerned about the significant number of illegal activities that have recently occurred in the park. These crimes have included drug dealing, illegal drinking, and the firing of guns. Members of the South District's Community Policing Team (CPT) were working proactively in the area of Penn Park late Wednesday afternoon when officers spotted two men consuming beer in the park's pavilion, which is prohibited. One of the men walked away from officers. He was later found to have several small bags of marijuana in his pant's pocket. A CPT officer retraced the suspect's steps and found a loaded handgun - a silver-colored Derringer 38 special – stashed near the park’s shelter.

Upon arrival officers located spent shell casings in the parking lot of Wiggies Tavern. Witness(es) indicate there was some form of physical altercation between male customers shortly before the incident. No reported injuries. Investigation continues.

properties.Suspect: Matthew J. Yancy, age 18, Fitchburg WisconsinCharges: (1) Carrying Concealed Weapon (S.S.941.23)(2) Possession Of THC (S.S. 961.41(3g)(e)
properties.Details: On 6/17/2008 at approximately 3PM, Madison Police Officers and a Detective were in the 5200 block of Williamsburg Way when they recognized a subject they believed to be Matthew J. Yancy.   Authorities were acting off of information that led them to believe Yancy was wanted in connection with a burglary investigation by The Monona Police Department.  Since the probable cause bulletin that had been disseminated clearly named Yancy, he was contacted and subsequently arrested.  Authorities would search Yancy and find a loaded .22 revolver and ammunition along with .7grams of Marijuana(THC).  Agents with both the US Marshals and ATF (Alcohol Tobacco & Firearms) were on scene as well.  When Yancy was asked about the gun he had in his possession, he stated he had found the firearm in a nearby area.  Yancy would be booked into the Dane County Jail on the two charges of Carrying a Concealed Weapon and Possession of THC.  Other charges related to why Yancy was contacted initially were dealt with by The Monona Police Department.PO Howard PayneMadison Police Department

properties.Suspect: Perpetrator is described as a male, black, late 20's to early 30's, 6'2", bald, earring in each ear, wearing a red shirt, and baggy blue jeans.
properties.Details: On June 30th - shortly before the midnight hour - Madison Police were dispatched to the PDQ store on Fish Hatchery Road for a weapons offense. Witnesses say a man was in line to buy some cigarettes when something popped out of the waistband of his baggy blue jeans. One witness says he looked down and realized the dropped item was in fact a gray automatic type handgun. The gun's owner made a comment to the effect of, "Oh s ____!" He then retrieved the weapon, tucked it back in his waistband, paid for his cigarettes, and quickly left the store. Also present in the PDQ at the time of the gun drop were three Town of Madison Police Officers. They were not near the cash register, but over near the area where one would glean a cup of coffee, and as such did not see the gun drop. One witness said he knew the officers were there but did not want to alert them fearing he might end up in the middle of a gun battle. He waited until the gunman had left the area before contacting authorities.

On 7/6/08 a resident of an apartment on Troy Drive called 911 shortly after 4:00 a.m. He said someone had just fired several bullets at his sliding glass door. Responding officers discovered multiple holes in the door, and the resident reported hearing about a half dozen rounds.  Officers could not find any bullet holes in the interior walls of the apartment. Investigators believe the resident was targeted in this attack, although a specific motive has not been established. There were no injuries, and the resident did not see the perpetrator.

properties.Suspect: A 12-year-old boy was returned to his home and could be cited for Misuse of 911, and a Curfew Violation.
properties.Details: On June30th, around 11:20 p.m., several Madison Police Officers responded to the 3000 block of East Washington Avenue after a caller indicated he had witnessed a woman being chased by a knife-wielding man. Officers found no suspect, and no victim, but did locate a 12-year-old boy who was in possession of a cell phone. A subsequent investigation revealed the youngman had called Dane County 911 16 times that night. Most were hang-up calls to which an officer was also sent to investigate. The caller admitted his involvement explaining, "It's fun to see all the police drive by with lights on, and I like it." A Madison Police Officer explained the dangers of providing false information to emergency responders, and how he tied up vital resources at a time when others were in real need of assistance. The suspect was taken to his home and released to a parent. A follow-up investigation is being done and the boy will likely be cited  (see potential charges listed above).
A subject was injured by another with an unconfirmed object.  Appears to be an isolated incident with no additional threat to the community.  Injuries sustained are non-life threatening.

properties.Suspect: SUSPECT#1: W/M Age UnknownSUSPECT#2: B/M Age Unknown

properties.Details: At the above date and time MPD was sent to the above area regarding a disturbance. While checking the area, officers were approached by WALLACE who stated the above individuals had robbed him of his wallet and battered him. A search for the suspects met with negative results. WALLACE was conveyed to a friends house on Monroe Street, and soon afterwards, MPD was summoned to a location 2 blocks from the drop off site, to a traffic accident where WALLACE had a crash and rolled his vehicle. WALLACE was arrested for his 2nd OMVWI offense as a result. Investigation continues.

properties.Suspect: David Cody Flynn Jr., age 22, MadisonMr. Flynn was arrested and tentatively charged with five counts of Disorderly Conduct while Armed.
properties.Details: Early Sunday morning at 2:39 a.m. several Madison Police Officers began searching the downtown area for a man with a gun. Many frightened witnesses reported that a shirtless guy with a bloody mouth was walking around the State Street area holding what appeared to be a real firearm. One person said the suspect pointed the weapon at him and said, "Don't f____ with me tonight." Several witnesses felt scared for their safety. Officers located the suspect in the 400 block of West Johnson Street. He was in possession of a BB gun. The suspect indicated he been battered at the corner of State and Broom streets after bar time. He described his assailants as a black male, and a white male. This battery took place prior to the reports that led to his arrest.

properties.Suspect: Anthony M. Copenhefer, 26 of Madison
properties.Victim: Twenty five year old male. Resident of Madison
properties.Details: Officers were dispatched to the above location reference a disturbance in the area. While investigating the disturbance,officers heard the report of gunfire. A short time later the victim was located by officers and he told the officers that he believed he had been shot. A vehicle was also located in the area that had been shot. The victim was conveyed to a local hospital and treated for non-life threatening injuries that turned out to be the result of blunt force trauma. After a lengthy interview Copenhefer was arrested for disorderly conduct with the potential for additional charges resulting from the incident.UPDATE: Copenhefer has been booked into the jail on two counts of First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety for his actions during this disturbance.  Multiple subjects were involved in the disturbance and the investigation is ongoing.

properties.Suspect: Daryl E. Rogers, 12-31-65, MadisonCharges: Reckless Injury             CCW
properties.Details: Madison Police are investigating a stabbing that occurred in the 1100 Blk of Catalpa Circle at approximately 11:10 pm. A 20 year old male was stabbed once and admitted to a local hospital with non-life threatening injuries. The suspect was arrested at the scene. The investigation is still continuing.

On Friday night around 11:38 p.m. Madison Police went to Atwood Avenue where a woman had just been “shot” with a couple of paint balls. The victim was struck in the chest and stomach, and was complaining of pain. She said the shooter was inside a car that drove by heading towards Monona on Atwood. A witness said he could see two men in the front of the red car, and two women in the back. He thought it was a four-door Pontiac Grand Am. The victim said a second person was also hit but left. Officers found multiple rounds had been fired, with several hitting a nearby building. Dane County dispatchers indicated similar paint ball incidents had been reported earlier on the west side of Madison, and in Monona.

On Tuesday morning, just after 7:00 a.m., Madison Police were called to the 1900 block of Beld Street to take a report on damage to a SUV that was parked on the street. It was discovered that the Ford Explorer's rear window had been shot out. Officers also found a second vehicle - a Chevy Blazer - had been struck in the fender by a bullet, and a third round may have penetrated a nearby home. There were no reports of injuries. Around 3:15 a.m., also on Tuesday morning, a citizen called 911 and reported hearing gunfire in the Beld Street area; however, responding officers could find no evidence of the incident in the darkness of the hour.

properties.Suspect: Male, age 13, MadisonTeen was cited for person under age 18 being armed with a pellet gun.
properties.Details: On Tuesday night, around 8:00 p.m., several Madison Police officers responded to the 2200 block of South Thompson Drive for a report of a teen with a gun. Minutes earlier a concerned resident had seen the suspect and a half-dozen other young men walk past the caller's residence on Wagon Trail. Officers detained the teens at gunpoint near Orlando Bell Park, and discovered the weapon in questions was actually a pellet gun. The teen carrying it said he had pointed it at the feet of his friends while pulling the trigger, but never intended to hurt anyone. He said they were just playing. The 13 year-old went on to explain that another friend had removed the orange plastic piece from the gun's muzzle to make it look more like a real handgun.  All of the teens’ parents were called to the scene to view the weapon, and officers counseled the young men about how dangerous it is to walk around in public with something that looks like a real gun.In her report on the incident, a Madison Police sergeant wrote: "This was another adrenaline spiking near-miss situation where, with one suspect pointing the pistol at his friends, we were fortunate not have an officer-involved shooting."An attachment to this release shows a police officer's real Glock Model 19 next to the modified BB pistol. Officers must make split-second decisions in these cases, and discerning a real threat from a fake can be very difficult.

properties.Suspect: Perpetrator #1 is described as a male, Hispanic, late teens to early 20's, short, thin, with shoulder length hair and a goatee. properties.Address: 1965 Atwood Avenue Chase Bank ATM machine
properties.Details: On September 1st, at 5:54 a.m., Madison Police were called to an ATM machine outside of the Chase Bank on Atwood Avenue. A man reported that he was using the ATM around 5:30 a.m. when a car came squealing into the driveway. The victim says two men jumped out and one fired several shots from a handgun. The victim soon realized it was a loud cap type gun. He drove quickly away from the ATM and called police.

On Labor Day, at 5:44 p.m., Madison Police were sent to the 3200 block of Snowy Parkway after a motorist had a car window shot out by a BB. Officers also discovered that a nearby home had been hit with a couple of BBs. The driver of the car said she had just turned southbound onto Snowy Parkway from McKee Road when she heard a loud pop. The woman's husband was in the passenger seat and got out to investigate. He found the rear driver's side door window shattered, and heard another popping noise. He associated the noise with someone firing a BB gun. Officers also learned a second motorist had a rear window damaged while driving in the area around 12:25 p.m. on Monday. West District officers are investigating.

properties.Suspect: Perpetrator #1 is described as a male, black, 30 years old, 6', 250 lbs., short hair, facial stubble, wearing a blue polo shirt, blue jeans, and white tennis shoes with a square toe. properties.Victim: Male, age 28, MadisonVictim suffered a cut to the chest and arm. He was transported to a local hospital with non-life threatening injuries.
properties.Details: Early Wednesday morning, around 2:12 a.m., Madison Police were called to the 2100 block of Allied Drive following a stabbing. The first officer on the scene observed several people standing in the street, eight to ten on the sidewalk, and some others running from the scene. A 28-year old Madison man said he had been stabbed, and he was taken to a local hospital where he was treated for a couple of wounds.  The victim said he had been at a friend's house on Allied Drive, and had left to meet a cab. Once outside he said three men approached and perpetrator #1 asked for money. Number one proceeded to punch the victim. He also cut him on the chest, and on the arm. The perpetrators ran from the scene.

In the vicitm's apt, they recovered a possible weapon responsible for the injury.  Incident is still under investigation.  Injuries are not life threatening.

The victim and suspect were arguing when the victim was stabbed in the back with a knife.  The victim knows the suspect who is a 26 year old female. The suspect fled and has not been located. The victim is being treated at a local hospital for a non-life threatening injury.

properties.Victim: 38-year old male with injuries to his head

properties.Victim: Male, age 24Victim was shot in the ankle.

properties.Arrested: Torey Michael Henry Huegli30 years oldWaterloo, IACharges:-Obstructing a police officer-Possession of THC-Possession of Drug Paraphernalia-Possession of Methamphetamine-Outstanding Warrant from IowaGrant Lee Miller26 years oldLaporte City, IA-Possession of Methamphetamine
properties.Details: On 3/13/05 Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 7400 block of Mineral Point Rd reference two individuals who had purchased numerous boxes of Sudafed.  After the investigation by officers, it was learned that the Sudafed was going to be used for the manufacturing of methamphetamine.  Once the arrests were made a search of the vehicle revealed a handgun with ammunition, hundreds of tablets of Sudafed, empty boxes of Sudafed and other items that contribute to the manufacturing of methamphetamine.  Apparently the two individuals drove from Iowa to Madison to purchase items that could be manufactured into methamphetamine.  The Madison Police Department is advising businesses that sell Sudafed to be mindful of those purchasing multiple boxes and report suspicious behavior to police.

properties.Arrested: Robert C. Sanders, 31 year-old, Madison.  Charged with:  Possession with Intent to Deliver.Marlow A. Hayes, 28 year-old, Charlotte, NC.  Charged with:  Possession with Intent to Deliver, Criminal Damage to Property and Probation Violation
properties.Details: On 4/9/2005 at approximately 6:00 p.m. a Madison Police Officer was taking a report regarding some property damage when the victim pointed out to the officer that the suspect was entering another vehicle.  The Officer followed the vehicle and initiated a traffic stop in the 1600 block of Almo Ave.  Through the course of the investigation it was learned that an occupant of the vehicle was the suspect of the property damage.  Officers also noted a strong odor of marijuana coming from inside the vehicle.  K-9 Arno and his handler arrived on scene and Arno detected an odor of marijuana inside the car as well.  As a result, Madison Police Officers found 12 pounds of marijuana along with several thousand dollars worth of cash.  Both Hayes and Sanders were arrested and transported to the Dane County Jail.

properties.Arrested: Mario Webb, 20, Madison:  Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent, Possession with Intent to deliverLinda Walker, 30, Madison: Possession with intent to deliver,  2 warrants: Operating while suspended/Parole
properties.Details: On 9/1/05 at approximately 4:37 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the 2100 block of Allied Drive reference a disturbance and allegedly threats to shoot people.  As officers investigated the incident they were able to develop suspect information as the suspect had fled prior to police arrival. Shortly after taking the report, an officer observed the suspect vehicle and driver matching the suspect description (Webb).  The officer followed the vehicle and eventually made a traffic stop with the assistance of other officers.  Through the course of the investigation, officers recovered 45 baggies of marijuana inside the vehicle.  The total amount of marijuana recovered was 93 grams. Officers also learned that the Webb was operating in a stolen vehicle.

properties.Arrested: Kenneth Hill, 17, Madison:  Possession of THC (marijuana) with Intent to Deliver
properties.Details: On 9/15/2005 at approximately 9:10 a.m. the Memorial High School Education Resource Officer was alerted to a student suspected of having marijuana.  In contacting Hill, who had a strong odor of marijuana on him, the officer performed a search.  In searching Hill the officer found 7.6 grams of marijuana on him which were individually wrapped in 12 different bags.  Hill was placed under arrest pursuant to the aforementioned charges and transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: Jordan Lehr, 23, Madison: Possession of a Firearm by a Felon, Possession with intent to deliver cocaine
properties.Details: On 9/27/05 at approximately 2:45 p.m. law enforcement from the Dane County Narcotics and Gang Task Force (DCNGTF) attempted to make a traffic stop on Jordan Lehr's vehicle, which he was operating on Cottage Grove Rd.  Lehr continued driving and tossed a large white substance, packaged in a plastic bag, out of his car.  Eventually Lehr pulled over onto southbound Hwy 51 at Cottage Grove Rd where he was arrested without incident.  The suspected drugs thrown from the vehicle were later recovered.  As a result of their investigation, the DCNGTF conducted a search of Lehr's residence in which a 9mm handgun was recovered along with 1207 grams of cocaine, 19.6 grams of marijuana and U.S. currency.  Also seized was a 2000 Lincoln LS vehicle.

properties.Arrested: Male, 16, 11th grade, Madison (Possession of THC with intent to deliver)
properties.Details: On 12/12/2005 the Madison Memorial Educational Resource Officer (ERO) went to the principal's office for a drug investigation the school wanted to report.  The officer contacted the student who stated he had smoked marijuana that day.  A consensual search was administered.  The searched yielded a Macbeth literature book that had been hallowed out.  Inside the book was a Triton T2 scale.  The search also yielded $45 cash and 15.8 grams of marijuana.  The student was arrested and transported to the Juvenile Reception Center.

properties.Arrested: Joseph Thigpen, 29, Madison:  Possession with intent to deliver cocaine
properties.Details: On 1/26/06 at approximately 5:30 p.m. Madison Police Officers were effectuating the arrest of Thigpen on a drug charge.  Thigpen was in his vehicle and would not exit.  One officer attempted to shatter the heavily tinted window with an instrument.  As Thigpen still did not cooperate the officer reached into the broken window to pull him out.  In doing so, the officer suffered a cut on his arm that required 13 stitches.  Thigpen was taken into custody without further incident.

properties.Arrested: 15 year-old male student:  Possession of THC with intent to deliver.  16 year-old student: Possession with intent to deliver. 17 year-old male student: Possession with intent to deliver.
properties.Details: On 2/14/06 at approximately 11:15 a.m. the Madison Police Department's Educational Resource Officer at Memorial H.S. was alerted to a drug incident.  The officer learned that three students had done a hand-to-hand drug buy in the hallway of the school.  A student asked a fourth student, not listed above, where to buy some marijuana.  That student made the connection with some other students.  During class the interested buyer was motioned into the hallway by the selling students.  The astute teacher witnessed the exchange in the hallway and confronted the student as he returned to class.  Approximately .4 grams of marijuana was recovered from student.  The officer conducted the investigation, recommended charges and released the students to their parents.

On 12/8/06 at approximately 7:57 p.m. the Madison Police South/West Community Police Team (CPT) executed a search warrant in an apartment building in the 2300 block of Allied Drive.  Information was learned that short-term drug trafficking was affecting the apartment building and neighborhood.  Based on a police investigation a search warrant was drafted and executed.  This remains an ongoing investigation and there are no further details available at this time.

properties.Arrested: Deigo Castillo-Cruz, 31, Madison:  Possess Marijuana with intent to deliver, Probation violation
properties.Details: On 3/12/07 at 11:12 p.m. a Madison Police Officer initiated a traffic stop due to a violation.  The officer eventually placed Castillo-Cruz under arrest for OWI.  After the arrest, the officer searched the vehicle with the officer's K-9 partner "Greg".  K-9 Greg detected marijuana in the vehicle and alerted his handler.  Ultimately, over 8 lbs of marijuana was recovered from the vehicle along with over $2,500 cash.

properties.Arrested: n/a
properties.Details: On 4/19/07 at 8:13 a.m. Madison Police responded to a suspicious package found at a local business.  It was learned that staff had called a plumber to fix a toilet that wasn't working properly.  The plumber discovered crack. . . 13 grams of crack cocaine residing in the toilet fixture.  Police took the crack for destruction.

properties.Arrested: Male (s)
properties.Details: On June 21st at 5:36 p.m. Madison Police responded to a home in the 1500 Block of Droster Road to meet with a landlord who was having tenant problems. Inside the home officers discovered the residence had been converted into a "grow house." Some 300 marijuana plants, which members of the Dane County Narcotics & Gang Task Force say are each worth between $800 and $1,000, were seized. It did not appear anyone was living in the home. No arrests have been made, and those who rented the property are being sought. The Dane County Narcotics & Gang Task Force is seeking any information citizens might have about the marijuana operation. Task Force members can be contacted at 245-5783.

properties.Arrested: Robert J DorseyAge 26, ChicagoTentatively charged with Resisting & Obstructing
properties.Details: On June 27th at 10:53 Madison Police responded to a report of an attempted armed robbery at the Baymont Inn. No suspects, no victim could be found. A short time later the victim showed up at the Holiday Inn, 1109 Fourier Dr. He reported that a suspect with two guns had tried to rob him at the Baymont. However, it became clear he did not want to provide police with his own personal identification. As questioning continued Dorsey attempted to swallow a large bag of what appeared to be crack cocaine. Officers made every attempt to prevent this act. Eventually bags that had contained the suspected drugs were retrieved but not their contents. Dorsey was taken to a local hospital.

properties.Address: Darbo Dr., Webb Ave., E. Washington Ave., Marquette St.
properties.Details: On Thursday evening, September 13th, the North-East District Community Police Team, with the help of the Dane County Narcotics & Gang Task Force, engaged in a "reverse-sting" drug operation in the Darbo/Webb/Marquette area off of East Washington Avenue. Undercover officers posed as drug dealers. Seven (listed above) were arrested during the operation. Surveillance and undercover officers also observed individuals flashing rival gang signs at one another. Madison Police have detected a rise in drug/prostitution activity in the area and efforts like the one Thursday evening will continue in the near future.

On October 3, 2007 the Dane County Narcotics & Gang Task Force attempted to arrest two drug suspects. The cases are unrelated, and it was coincidence that both were sought on the same day. However, both men have significant drug histories in Madison, and agents believe they maybe armed. The task force is seeking citizen help in trying to locate the two men.The first is Telly A. Kingcade, age 30. He is 5'8" and 210 lbs.On Wednesday, October 3, members of the Task Force engaged Mr. Kingcade in a high-speed chase, which was terminated before a traffic stop could be made.Following the chase a search warrant was executed on Mr. Kingcade's residence. Seized were a Tech 9 handgun, a 12-gauge shotgun, a 22 cal. long rifle, crack cocaine, drug packaging materials and money.Mr. Kingcade has charges pending against him of Felony Eluding, Maintaining a Drug House, as well as various drug and weapons charges.The second wanted suspect is Mr. Maurice R. Bowman, age 30. He is 6'4", and 190 lbs.On October 3 the Task Force, working cooperatively with the Drug Enforcement Administration, executed a search warrant on Mr. Bowman's west Madison home. Recovered in that search were crack cocaine, marijuana, drug packaging materials, and money.Mr. Bowman is wanted on pending drug charges and a warrant for non-support.Anyone with information is asked to call the Madison Police Crime Stoppers line at 266-6014. Callers can remain anonymous and maybe eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Suspect: Juakein R. Coles, Age 17, FitchburgTentatively charged with Unauthorized Presence on School Property & Possession with Intent to Deliver Marijuana
properties.Details: On October 10th at 11:38 a.m. a Madison police officer on routine patrol was driving around West High School when he spotted a group of young people hanging out on a retaining wall on the north side of the building. As members of the group saw the marked squad one individual began walking away from the rest. The officer believes the others from the group were yelling at him not to run. The officer then got out of his car and approached the suspect. The officer noted that as he did this the suspect very softly uttered the words, "oh s---". It was determined the suspect was not a student at West, and was not supposed to be on school grounds. He was found to be carrying individually wrapped bags of suspected marijuana. He also had $275 in cash. The suspect told the officer his mother and grandmother gave the money to him for his birthday. The officer quickly noted that the suspect's birthday is July 4th and it is now October. While the officer questioned the suspect he noticed that the young man's cell phone continued to ring over and over again.

On Thursday night, October 18th, Madison’s North/East Community Police Team working in concert with the Dane County Narcotics and Gang Task Force conducted an undercover operation in the Darbo/Worthington neighborhood just off of East Washington Avenue. Police officers in plainclothes posed as either drug dealers, or drug buyers. The above people were picked up during the operation. This enforcement effort follows complaints by citizens that there has been a good deal of short-term traffic coming in and out of the neighborhood. Most of those cited/arrested/contacted by police during this sting were not residents of the neighborhoodThose arrested/cited are:James E. Grant, Age 18, MadisonTentative Charges -Theft, Operating after Suspension, Expired Registration, Intoxicants in Vehicle Underage PersonJamar Reynolds, Age 19, Madison Tentative Charge-Open Intoxicants in a Motor VehicleRachel Tuberville, Age 17, NPATentative Charges- Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Warrant Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Bail JumpingWillie Triplett, Age 45, NPATentative charges-Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Possession of THC Eugene F. Randolph, Age 30, MadisonTentative charge-Attempt to Possess Cocaine BaseBecky Field, Age 39, Madison Tentative charges-Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Attempt to Possess Cocaine Base, Loitering   For the Purposes of Prostitution                          Brenda Freilinger, Age 42, Madison Tentative Charges-Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Attempt to Possess Cocaine Base, Loitering   For the Purposes of Prostitution    Female, age uncertain, MadisonTentative charges-Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, Attempt to Possess Cocaine Base, Loitering For the Purposes of Prostitution    Totals       Criminal Charges   12                City Ordinance         4                Traffic                      4

properties.Suspect: Ronald L. Rudd, Age 19, MadisonMr. Rudd has been arrested and tentatively charged with Possession of THC with Intent to Deliver. He is also in custody on a Probation Hold.
properties.Details: On January 2, 2008 around 5:32 p.m. South District Patrol Officers, members of the South District Community Police Team (CPT), and members of the Dane County Narcotics and Gang Task Force joined with the Cypress-Magnolia Neighborhood Officer in executing a search warrant at 914 Magnolia Lane. This property has been the subject of numerous citizen complaints and police attention. Cocaine base (crack), marijuana, a digital scale, packaging material, air guns, a pistol, a rifle, & ammunition were seized during the search. Mr. Ronald Rudd was arrested in connection with the investigation, and others could face charges. The South District of the Madison Police Department is committed to responding to community concerns like those raised in relationship to this property.

properties.Suspect: Eric T. Lemke, age 28, MadisonMr. Lemke was arrested and tentatively charged with Maintaining a Drug Dwelling, Possession of Marijuana with Intent to Deliver, and Manufacturing Marijuana.
properties.Details: Around 12:23 p.m. on Tuesday Madison Police and Madison Fire were called to an apartment building in the 1800 block of Fordem Avenue for a report of smoke filling the second floor. Responding officers began to knock on doors to get residents out. During this process it was ascertained that the smoke was coming from inside one particular apartment. A MPD officer knocked on the door. A resident opened it, but would not let the officer enter the apartment. He (the resident) insisted there was no need for alarm that he was simply burning some sage. Nevertheless, firefighters needed to determine for themselves the cause of the smoke. Police and fire personnel entered the apartment. An ashtray was found to have in it a substance that was still smoking and smoldering. Firefighters checked out the rest of the apartment for additional smoking sources and discovered marijuana grow operation – complete with custom ductwork -- in a bedroom. Members of the Dane County Narcotics and Gang Task Force were summoned. They seized 44 pot plants, and the resident was arrested.

properties.Suspect: N/A
properties.Arrested: 1. Emmanuel G. Cervantes-Reyes, 21-year-old M/H of Madison Charges: Possession With Intent To Deliver THC (PTC) & Operating After Revocation2. Juan C. Martinez-Arias, 18-year-old  M/H of Madison Charges:  Possession With Intent To Deliver THC (PTC)
properties.Details: On 03/21/2008 at approximately 1PM, a Madison Police Officer was doing surveillance in the 400 block of West Gilman Street & West Gorham Street when attention was called to a 2001 black Chevy Impala.  The officer quickly recognized suspicious activity of individuals contacting this vehicle, and this car would later be stopped on North Park Street moments later for numerous traffic violations.  The driver (Cervantes-Reyes) & front seat passenger (Martinez-Arias) had no identification whatsoever, but based on suspicions the officer had related to drugs, a K-9 Officer was requested at the scene of the traffic stop for further investigation.A Madison Police Department K-9 handler would arrive, and a sniff of the exterior/interior of the vehicle would result in illegal contraband (Marijuana) being located in several areas of the car.  No individual within this vehicle would claim knowledge or responsibility for approximately 4.5 grams of Marijuana and other items of interest, but both Cervantes-Reyes and Martinez-Arias would be arrested for Possession With Intent To Deliver THC and Party To A Crime respectively.  There were 2 other juvenile passengers in the vehicle that would be returned to their residences by police.  This is yet another case of solid police work on the part of the officer conducting the initial surveillance and accessibility of K-9 related resources.  The actions of these officers resulted in an arrest that continues to promote improved quality of life for citizens within the City Of Madison.

properties.Suspect: Samuel J. Pearson, age 27, MadisonMr. Pearson was arrested and tentatively charged with Resisting/Obstructing a Police Officer (2 counts), Probation Hold, Operating after Revocation (4 counts), Possession of THC, Failure to Report to Jail, Possession with Intent to Deliver THC, Speeding, and Operating while Revoked.
properties.Details: On Thursday a Madison police officer was working on morning drive time speed enforcement along East Washington Avenue when he spotted a green '96 Cadillac weaving in and out of traffic. The officer locked a laser unit on the Caddy and clocked it at 60 miles-per-hour. The speed limit on this stretch of East Wash is 35. The officer then pulled the car over. While talking with the driver the officer had to keep warning him to stop moving around, and to keep his hands where the officer could see them. But, the driver kept reaching into the glove compartment, and into the middle console. At one point he had in his hand a bottle of cologne, which he sprayed around the inside of the vehicle. At this point the officer asked the man to step outside of the car. During this process the suspect broke away from the officer, and took off running. He did not get far as other officers were arriving at the scene. They took him into custody. A Dane County Deputy also showed up with a police dog. The K9 had great interest in the smell of something in the dash area near the car’s steering wheel. Officers discovered the whole display of that area of the dash actually pulls out, and that behind it is a hiding place. It was there that more than 30 grams of marijuana was discovered. It was contained in many individually wrapped packages. The marijuana and other items - including the bottle of Hilfiger Athletic cologne - were taken into evidence.

properties.Victim: Male, age 19, Phillips, WisconsinFriends took victim to a local hospital. He was in critical condition.
properties.Details: On Tuesday, May 27, 2008, around 12:25 a.m., Madison Police were called to a local hospital after a young man was admitted for a possible drug overdose. The teen's friends say many had come to Madison to attend a Memorial Day party at a residence on East Johnson Street. At some point during the evening witnesses say the victim began acting strangely, making screaming type noises, while becoming increasingly agitated and sweaty. They say his tongue appeared to be swelling, and he looked as though he was foaming at the mouth. In addition, his entire body was shaking and convulsing. They say he had been drinking, and may have taken a drug called CT2, which they indicated he might have purchased over the Internet. A member of the Dane County Drug & Gang Task Force says CT2 is an illegal hallucinogen similar to Ecstasy.

properties.Suspect: Carlos D. Wilson, age 19, Madison WisconsinCharge: Delivery Of THC (Marijuana) - (S.S. 961.41(h)/961.49S
properties.Arrested: Robert L. Mims, Jr., age 18, Madison WisconsinCharges: (1) Possession of THC (Marijuana) (2) Probation Violation (S.S. 973.10)
properties.Details: On 6/16/08 at approximately 5:30PM, Officers working in The South Community Policing Team (CPT) were on a routine patrol assignment in the 900 block of West Badger Road when an officer witnessed a drug transaction.  Based on this officer having other resources available, he and fellow officers were able to contact 3 individuals that were the focus of the drug investigation.  Officers report that that after contacting the parties, Robert L. Mims, Jr. was in possession of 1.75 grams of Marijuana (THC); which would be found concealed in his mouth.  Carlos D. Wilson was charged with Delivery of THC.  It should be known that this transaction occurred just a short distance away from a neighborhood park and school.  Both Mims and Wilson were arrested and conveyed to the Dane County Jail on charges listed above. The CPT did an outstanding job in being alert to one problem that has negatively impacted this particular community.  The CPT will continue to monitor activities such as this and remain active, having goals to thwart out any illegal activity that is not productive within the community.PO Howard PayneMadison Police Department

properties.Suspect: N/A
properties.Arrested: N/A
properties.Details: On 6/18/2008 at approximately 2:45PM, Madison Police were dispatched to the 2400 block of Sommers Avenue reference suspicious people in the area.  Earlier in the day, Dane County Sheriffs Deputies attempted to serve eviction paperwork to residents at 2426 Center Avenue but fled before deputies could contact them.  Area residents reported to police that there had been 2-3 unfamiliar persons walking in the back yards of homes in this area after deputies had left, and when confronted claimed to be searching for cell phones they had lost.  The suspicious persons were checking in bushes, shrubs, and alongside a residence with differing explanations of why they were in the area.In an attempt to provide the residents of this neighborhood with an additional measure of security, Madison Police used a dog to sniff the area and was subsequently lead to a large package of crack cocaine hidden in the bushes; believed to be dumped there by individuals that had fled from deputies earlier.  Area residents assisted police in this matter by providing specific information about suspicious behavior, and it inevitably led to a large amount of illegal drugs being located by MPD Canine/Handler.  Approximately 80.5 grams of Cocaine Base was recovered in this case, and a collaborative effort on the part of both citizens and police kept the illegal/dangerous substance out of the hands of unsuspecting children.  This was an outstanding effort on the part of all parties involved in this case and reflected another instance where citizens make a difference by being observant and aware of what is going on in their community.

properties.Arrested: Robert Gundy57 years oldMadison-Fraudulent Writings
properties.Details: On 3/16/2005 at approximately 11:48 am Madison Police responded to the 4500 block of Verona Rd for a retail theft.  A Madison Police Officer investigated the retail theft to learn that Gundy had entered the store without merchandise, loaded his cart and went to return the unpaid for items.  In doing so Gundy was able to receive store credit because he did not have a receipt.  It was learned that Gundy has done this in the past only to attempt to sell his store credit cards while still inside the building to unsuspecting customers, for a lesser cost.  Officials estimate thousands of dollars have been credited to Gundy.  In conducting a routine data check on Gundy it was also learned that he has an outstanding warrant in Iowa for retail theft.  Gundy was transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: Male, White, 6', 20-25 years old, Brown hair, White Long Sleeve T-Shirt, Black sweatpants, Black baseball hat
properties.Details: On 7/22/06 at approximately 9:22 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the Hollywood Video for a retail theft.  It was learned that the suspect entered the store and wandered around before bringing several expensive X-Box videos to the front counter, acting like he was going to pay.  The suspect then fled the store with over $600 in merchandise.  The store employee chased the individual out of the store.  In confronting the suspect, a handgun was produced by the suspect.  The employee retreated.  A K-9 search did not locate the suspect who fled on foot across S. Gammon Rd.  This remains an open investigation.  Anyone with information about this crime is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Michael Jadzewski, 19, Brooklyn:  Retail Theft
properties.Details: On 7/19/06 at approximately 9:00 a.m. Madison Police Officers responded to a retail theft complaint and were told store employees were chasing the suspect, Jadzewski.  Officers learned that Jadzewski had attempted to leave the Farm & Fleet store and the alarm went off.  A store clerk contacted Jadzewski and asked him why the alarm went off.  Jadzewski seemed nervous and gave the clerk his wallet and tried to pass the alarm again.  It still went off.  Jadzewski took off his shoes and the alarm still went off.  The clerk then asked what the bulge was in his pants and it was a metallic type work glove.  Jadzewski then took off running and the clerk, along with others, chased him.  Jadzewski crossed Hwy 51 on foot and was struck by a van swerving out of the way.  Jadzewski fell to the ground, as he was hit the drive-side door, and then got back up continuing to run away.  He was confronted employees of another business, across Hwy 51, who detained him until officers arrived.  Jadzewski was cited for retail theft and was free to go after treatment to his foot, at a local hospital.  He believes the van ran over his foot.

properties.Arrested: Male, 43, Middleton: Retail Theft citation14 year-old son, Middleton: Capias, Retail Theft, Obstructing
properties.Details: On 4/27/07 a Madison Police Officer took a retail theft complaint from a grocery store in the 700 block of S. Gammon Rd.  It was learned that the father and son had entered the store, generally shopped and was caught by security trying to leave without paying.  The two attempted to leave the store with over $200 worth of groceries in the cart.  Alert staff noticed the individuals putting groceries in plastic bags as they shopped. The youth lied about who he was, to the officer, causing the obstruction charge. Although the son admitted to taking part in the theft, the father asked to take full responsibility for their actions.

properties.Arrested: Laqueta Amos, Female, Age 20, Madison - Retail Theft, DC While ArmedHoratio Gardner, Male, Age 23, Madison - Retail Theft, Disorderly ConductBernice Amos, Female, Age 23, Madison - Battery, Retail Theft
properties.Details: On July 2, shortly before 6:20 p.m., Madison Police officers, who had been investigating an armed robbery across the street at the UW Credit Union, responded to the Wal-Mart for a report of a woman armed with a knife. Wal-Mart employees informed police that the woman, and two other suspects, had gotten into a confrontation with them outside the store as security tried to stop the group for retail theft. During the dispute, employees say, not only was a knife displayed, but a curtain rod was used to strike a Wal-Mart staff member in the head. One security staff member tackled the male suspect. Stolen items, including women's panties, and men's clothing, were recovered. Wal-Mart staff indicated the goods were worth 100's of dollars.

properties.Suspect: Paul W. Stewart, Age 25, MadisonArrested for Retail Theft, & a Parole Violation.Carl F. Jones, Age 26, MadisonArrested for Party to A Crime of Retail Theft, Unlawful Trespass warrant, & a Parole Violation.
properties.Details: On Saturday afternoon Shopko employees contacted police dispatchers who in turn alerted officers to a possible retail theft in the making.  Store loss prevention officers said there were suspects currently inside the store who were busy gathering up a large quantity of expensive video games, digital cameras, and navigation systems.  Officers positioned themselves at store exits. As this was happening one suspect took off out a back with a mesh laundry bag containing the merchandise. The other suspect walked out the front door toward what likely would have been the getaway car. Officers took both men into custody and recovered the stolen items. They were valued at over $2,600.

properties.Suspect: Marcus V. Rowe, age 28, MononaMr. Rowe was arrested and tentatively charged with Retail Theft and Disorderly Conduct.
properties.Details: On February 2, 2008, around 2:36 p.m., Madison Police headed out to the Wal-Mart on Nakoosa after store security personnel tackled a suspected shoplifter. Mr. Marcus Rowe had placed four laptop computers in a shopping cart. He had pushed them beyond the last point of sale and into an area designated for car repair when asset protection staff decided to intervene.

properties.Suspect: Henry C. Lee Sr., age 46, MadisonMr. Lee was arrested and tentatively charged with two counts of 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Retail Theft, and a Probation Violation.
properties.Details: On Saturday at around 1:21 p.m. Madison Police were called to a Verona Road grocery store after a retail theft suspect pulled a utility knife on two employees. The victims were trying to detain the suspect after he had placed more than a dozen toiletry items in his jacket without paying for them. The suspect did drop the merchandise, but also pulled out a utility knife, which he began swinging at the employees. He narrowly missed the face of one, and cut the pants of the other. The employees then backed away, and the suspect fled on foot. He did not make it far, as a responding MPD officer quickly spotted him and took him into custody.

properties.Suspect: Jerome Reed, 40 yr old male, Milwaukee resident, charged with Felony Retail Theft.
properties.Details: A clerk from Fred Meyer Jewelers reported that a customer came in and requested to view some loose diamonds.  While the customer was handling a diamond, the clerk noticed that the customer had substituted the real diamond for a fake diamond.  The customer left the store and store personnel were able to follow him to the parking lot where they observed him leave in a vehicle.  Store personnel were able to get the license plate of a vehicle, and the Wisconsin State Patrol later found and stopped the vehicle in Jefferson County.  A subsequent investigation established the customer was an occupant in that vehicle and he was then arrested and charged with felony retail theft.

properties.Suspect: Davarius L. McDonald, age 23, MadisonCited for two counts of Retail Theft.Jawon L. Clash, age 26, MadisonCited for Retail Theft.Arlena R. Lee, age 19, MadisonCited for Retail Theft.
properties.Details: On Monday night, shortly after 7:00 p.m., a witness provided Madison Police with the description of a getaway vehicle connected to a retail theft that had just occurred at the Famous Footwear store near East Towne. Armed with the information responding officers were quickly able to spot and pull over a Chevrolet Blazer that was still in the East Towne area. Inside the Blazer officers observed a dozen pair of stolen Nike sneakers with a retail value of $775. Also recovered were many stolen items just taken from a Fitchburg Target store (6321 Mckee Road). The first retail theft happened less than one hour before the Famous Footwear incident. Items from Target included numerous DVD's, cosmetics, clothes, and an LCD TV. The retail value of these items was placed at over $1360.

properties.Suspect: Perpetrator #1 is described as a female, Latino, 25 years old, 5'6", thin build, long brown hair with blonde streaks, wearing a black shirt and jeans.Perpetrator #2 is described as a male, Latino, late 20's, 5'6", muscular build, short black hair, acne, wearing a green striped shirt and jeans.Perpetrator #3 is described as a male, Latino, late 20's, 5'7" - 5'8", average build, short black hair, wearing a blue shirt, jeans, and a white chocker necklace.
properties.Details: On 9/25/2008, at 2:16 a.m., Madison Police were sent to Victoria's Secret, at West Towne Mall, following a retail theft that netted some crooks 45 brassieres. Retail value: 1905.00. A store manager said three people had entered the store an hour earlier, and that one perpetrator #2 had distracted employees while the other two thieves were by some drawers, which were later found to be sans brassieres. The trio’s female was carrying a white "Dots" shopping bag, and it is believed stolen items went out in it.

properties.Arrested: M/B approx. 30 Short hair, Dark Green New 4 dr. veh.
properties.Details: The suspect approached a 16 year old female at the bus stop and asked her to get into the car. She did not get in and the suspect drove away.

properties.Arrested: Roger McIntosh54 years-old, MadisonCharged:  Lewd and Lascivious
properties.Details: On 3/26/05 at approximately 3:49 p.m. Madison Police responded to the 1500 block of Troy Drive to take a complaint of a male exposing himself to children.  Several adults complained that McIntosh exposed himself in the confines of his home, but made it obvious for the general public to see him unclothed.  The officer had originally contacted McIntosh to warn him about behavior that could be misinterpreted, as he was standing in the window in bikini type underwear.  After this warning McIntosh continued to disrobe, in a public viewing fashion, and was subsequently arrested.  McIntosh was transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: White, Male,6', 180lbs about 40 years old
properties.Details: On 4/9/2005 at approximately 11:23 a.m. a female was entering her car after shopping in the 2500 block of Shopko Dr.  As the citizen was entering her car, she was approached by a male subject wanting either money or a ride to a homeless shelter or church.  The female refused to offer any help to this individual who wanted to come into her vehicle.  The male did not present any hostility, however the female reported this incident to the Madison Police Department.

properties.Arrested: 29 yr. old male
properties.Victim: 2 Madison Police Officers treated for injuries at local hospital.
properties.Details: Madison Police responded to a report of a naked man approaching civilians in the area of N. Sherman Ave.  An officer contacted the suspect near the Citgo station on Fordem Ave.  The suspect advanced on the officer and a physical struggle followed between the supect and several officers.  OC spray and a Taser were used to control the suspect, who was taken to a local hospital for treament of minor injuries.  Two of the officers involved in the struggle were also treated for injuries resulting from the incident.  Charges are pending.

properties.Arrested: 1 black male, 1 black female, dressed in blue.
properties.Details: On 10/6/2005 Madison Police responded to a complaint where individuals were impersonating police officers in order to scam the victim of money.  The victim reports that the suspects showed what appeared to be a real star badge and told him that they were investigating a bank scam.  After earning trust, the victim reports the suspects told him that by taking $1,000 out of a cash machine that he would be helping their investigation.  The victim went to the closest cash machine and started to withdrawal cash, while the suspects were waiting a short distance away. At one point the suspects even told the victim that police would follow-up with him with a search warrant of his residents.   The victim had suspicions this was a scam and went to a local business to verify the badge/police "sting".  The victim never gave the suspects any money.  No one has been arrested as police continue their investigation.

properties.Arrested: 1.) M/B, approx. 19-21 yoa, 5'6"-5'7", stocky build, short hair2.) M/B, approx. 19-21 yoa, 6' thin build, short hairVehicle: Light tan or champaigne colored vehicle similiar to a Ford Taurus (vehicle had a rounded shape)
properties.Victim: F/B, 19-21yoa, avg/stocky build, shoulder length hair that was last seen pulled away from her face; last seen wearing a waist length black coat and blue jeans
properties.Details: The Madison Police Department is looking for any information related to a possible abduction investigation.  At around 5:08pm this evening, a black female, approx. 19-21 years of age,  was seen near a tan colored vehicle, similiar to a Ford Taurus, which was parked outside the main doors of West Towne Mall.  This female was seen with two black males of similiar age and may have been forced into this vehicle.  If you have any information on this incident, please call the Madison Police Department at 266-4923.

properties.Arrested: Male, White, 40's, Goatee, Dark tank top, camouflage military style hat, dark blond hair
properties.Details: On 8/14/06 at approximately 7:20 p.m. a Madison Police Officer responded to a call of a suspicious person at West Towne Mall.  Specifically witnesses reported that an individual was in the children play land area of the mall exposing himself.  When the suspect noticed adult witnesses had seen him, he abruptly quit and exited the area quickly.  Mall security responded and attempted to detain him, but the individual fled as the security guard was distracted with someone unrelated to the situation.  Enough witnesses saw this incident and gave details to police.  One witness stated he recognized this individual being in the same play area approximately two months prior, taking photos of children.  This remains an open investigation and any suspicious behavior occurring, should result in a prompt call to police.

properties.Arrested: Male, black, approximately 25, black winter cap, driving a teal colored 4-door car, with the word "Oldsmobile" across the back window.  The vehicle's front passenger window had a black bag taped over it.
properties.Details: The Madison Police Department is investigating a possible enticement involving the above-listed individuals.  The female stated she was walking to Toki Middle School when the suspect approached her while staying in his vehicle.  The suspect asked her for her age and if she needed a ride.  The student quickly fled and told school authorities who contacted police.  If anyone has information regarding this case they are encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Male, black, 25-30 years old, 5'7, 165, Navy blue knit cap, dark blue waist-length puffy coat, dark skin complexion
properties.Details: The Madison Police Department is investigating two potential burglaries in the general location and general time-frame, possibly by the same person.  On 4/10 at 8:30 officers responded to the 200 block of N. Marquette St due to an alert neighbor seeing the suspicious male trying to break into the rear of an unoccupied home.  The male was kicking the back door and tried to break a window.  When the neighbor knocked on her window, the male took off.  Shortly after, at 8:51 a.m. officers responded to another potential burglary on Wirth Ct.  The homeowner was inside his residence when a black male was wondering inside.  The homeowner verbally confronted the subject who then fled.  A witness described the male exiting the house as leaving in a light purple or pink type car.  This male is similar in description as the Marquette St. suspect moments prior.

properties.Arrested: Male, White5'9"Short brown hair, trimmed beardWearing an unknown shirt
properties.Details: On Wednesday of last week, a 17 year old young woman reported that she was walking along N. Dickenson street, around a quarter past eight in the morning, when she heard someone coughing loudly. She turned and looked and observed the suspect looking at him. He was naked from the waste down. She says he remained in this state of undress following her for 1/2 a block.

properties.Arrested: Jimmy Luckinbill, Age 45, No permanant addressArrested on a probation hold for failure to report his permanent address as a condition of his sex offender status.Madison Police are asking the DA to charge Luckinbill with Sexual Assault of a Child & Attempted Child Enticement
properties.Details: On Monday July 30th, around 7:54 p.m., Madison police received a call from a concerned citizen who had just had contact with a middle age man and a young girl. The caller felt the situation looked suspicious. The man and child had been on the playground at Lapham Elementary School, and were now on bicycles heading towards the Capitol. A responding officer found the two near the intersection of North Patterson and East Dayton Streets. The girl indicated she did not know the man, but that he had befriended her while she was playing alone at Reynolds Field Park earlier in the evening. She then agreed to accompany (bike with) the suspect to Lapham School. She has indicated that he gave her a ring and touched her inappropriately. The suspect is a convicted sex offender. Madison detectives are seeking charges of Sexual Assault of a Child and Attempted Child Enticement. Their paperwork will go to the District Attorney for a charging decision. The suspect has been in custody since the incident, and there has been no additional danger to the community. Madison Police urge parents to talk with their children about stranger danger. The Department is very thankful for the actions of members of the community in coming to the aid of this child. A couple walking near the Lapham playground was the first to be concerned about what they were seeing. They went into the school and contacted a Lapham school employee. She came out, questioned the man and girl, and called police.

properties.Suspect: Suspicious Person: Male white, 25-28 years old, medium build, brown short hair, blue eyes, last seen driving a black SUV.
properties.Address: Blue Maple Trail (Far west side of Madison)
properties.Details: The Madison police department has recently taken four separate reports from females on the west side about a suspicious person. In each case a male driver asks for directions to the Star Cinema. The physical description of the driver is similar in all incidents; however, three put him in a black SUV, while a fourth indicates the man was driving a white pickup truck. The first reported incident was on October 8th. A woman says she was walking her dog near Bradbury Court when the man pulled up and inquired about directions.The second report came on October 12th. A 12-year-old girl contacted police. She is the one who said it was a white pickup involved. (There is a previous incident report on this case posted on our website.)The third and fourth reports both came on October 16th. At 4:53 p.m. the suspicious person approached a woman who had been walking on Blue Maple Trail. Then at 7:00 p.m. a female jogger, who was on a path near Turning Lead Road, was contacted.In all cases the females say the driver tended to linger after asking directions, and sometimes contacted them more than once in a short time period.One of the females said the suspicious man "creped" her out, and almost all said he made them feel unsafe.

properties.Suspect: Suspicious person is described as a male white, 5’8", late 20's, dirty blonde or brown somewhat curly hair, slim build, clean-shaven.
properties.Details: On Tuesday October 23rd around 10:38 a.m. Madison police took a report of an incident that occurred earlier that morning around 7:30 a.m. A woman taking her trash to the curb encountered a man who started yelling and grabbing the woman's arms. The woman's car was in the driveway. She got into the car and locked the doors. The man started knocking on the windows of the car, and tried to get in. The victim called her husband who was inside the house. The husband came out and the man left.His (the suspicious person's) description is similar to that given by multiple women who have been approached over the past couple of weeks by a man asking for directions to a local movie house. An incident report about those cases was previously posted on this website.Madison police believe this latest incident could be related to those mentioned in the earlier release. Unlike the earlier reports the suspicious person on the Chester Drive call was on foot. The other women have reported the man who approached them was in a vehicle.

On November 4, at 12:28 a.m. a Madison police officer took a report from the father of a 12-year-old girl. He says his daughter told him a guy in a red pickup truck drove slowly behind her, and pulled up beside her as she walked home from school on the afternoon of November 3. The daughter told her dad that a white male driver smiled and waved at her. She said he was 45-50, chubby, with a short beard, and she says he was wearing a white t-shirt and a baseball hat. The father said he did not think that much of the conversation until he found a flier that had come home from school. It advised parents of a recent incident where a man tried to get a 13-year old into his red colored vehicle (see incident report with case number 2007-132610).

On November eighth at 5:39 a Madison police officer was called to the residence of a 29-year-old woman. She had someone come to her door around 8:00 p.m. on November first. Initially she did not report the incident, but upon consultation with friends she thought it best to tell police what had occurred. The woman says a guy knocked on her door claiming to be an employee of Charter Cable. She could see her name on a piece of paper he had attached to a clipboard. The man told the woman for five dollars more a month she could get five more channels. The woman told the man she had no interest in more channels. She says he left and made rude comments as he departed. On November 7th the woman says she called Charter and learned they are not offering the deal suggested to her, that their employees would be wearing a uniform, and they would not be calling at 8:00 in the evening. She describes the man who came to her door as being white, 5'10", 180 lbs., clean-shaven, with no glasses. He was wearing a gray and blue winter coat.

On November 28th around 8:58 p.m. Madison police responded to a home on Doncaster Drive for a report of an attempted break-in. A man & woman reported that around 8:30 p.m. (on the 28th) someone was ringing their doorbell several times. They were already in bed and did not respond. About 15 minutes later they heard banging on a window at the rear of the house. The woman got up see what was causing the noise and saw a man trying to get into the house. As a light was turned on he took off. An officer discovered a screen had been removed from the window where the man had been. The woman was not able to provide much of a description of the person.

properties.Suspect: Suspicious person is described as a male, black, 20's, 5'8", medium short or twisted braids in hair, with a medium build. He was last seen wearing a dark colored winter hat, baggy jeans, black & blue puffy coat.
properties.Details: On January 4, 2008, at around 12:40 p.m., Madison Police were sent to Westgate Mall to take a report on a suspicious person. A 30-year-old woman reported that she and her four-year-old son had both been in a stall of the women's bathroom near the movie theater. While using the facility the woman looked up to see a man looking down at she and her son. She yelled out, "There's a man in here!" She and her son quickly exited the powder room and -- once into the mall area -- she witnessed the unwanted visitor run out an emergency exit door. She remembers finding it odd that the larger "disabled" stall was locked when they entered the bathroom, yet it did not appear to be occupied.

properties.Suspect: Suspicious person is described as a male, black, 6'2" - 6'5", slender build, with black hair that is beginning to gray. The man got out of an older model Ford hatchback. The Ford was seen traveling in the neighborhood with a tan full-size sedan.
properties.Details: On Sunday, March 2, 2008, Madison Police took a report from a resident on Van Hise Avenue about a possible ruse. The resident says a man (described above) claimed to be in need of gas money so he could visit his hospitalized son in Janesville. The resident says the man must have forgotten that he approached her with the same story a week earlier near Monroe Street. During the first encounter she says the man was quite emotional about his plight. She gave him $30. When he approached the second time she accused him of lying. He promptly left.

properties.Suspect: Shyon E. Corner, 39 year old maleCharges: (1) Lewd & Lascivious (3 counts) - S.S. 944.20(2) Resisting (2 counts) - S.S. 946.41(1)(3) Possession of Thc - S.S. 961.41 (3G)(E)
properties.Victim: Three (23 year old) females of Madison
properties.Details: On June 25th, 2008 at approximately 2:03AM, Madison Police were called to the 10 block of West Gilman Street reference a male subject exposing himself.  Upon arrival, police would contact three 23-year-old females who arrived back at their residence just before 2AM, and to their surprise confronted by Shyon E. Corner making inappropriate comments to them.  Not only was Corner saying things that were not appropriate, he exposed his genitalia.   The unsuspecting females quickly moved into their residence and contacted the police with a specific description of Corner.Police would arrive on scene and find Corner face down in a prone position on the side of a residence.  Once Corner determined that police were attempting to contact him, he would flee the scene; jumping fences as police commanded him to stop.  Corner momentarily eluded police only to be located a short time later by a MPD Sergeant, but Corner would continue his relentless attempt to flee police until he was finally located hiding in thick underbrush near the 300 block N. Carroll Street.  Corner did not comply with officers to show his hands when contacted, but the threat of a Taser quickly changed his demeanor. Corner, when questioned, would deny having run from police and exposing himself to the original complainants.  He did not have a reasonable explanation for his torn clothing, but did state that he was lying in the underbrush to sleep!  A number of officers and a canine were utilized in the search of this subject, and Corner was confined at the Dane County Jail on charges listed above.The Madison Police Department advises citizens to continue to use diligence in reporting suspicious behavior with details to police in order that matters can be investigated immediately.  This case worked extremely well and no individual was injured due to tactical measures used by officers on scene.PO Howard PayneMadison Police Department

properties.Suspect: Driver is described as a male, black, dark skin, 30's, medium build, "big" hair, and a beard. He was driving a large green four-door sedan with some rust on its' rear.
properties.Details: On Wednesday morning Madison Police took a report from a 13-year old girl who was concerned about a man she had seen twice in the past week. The girl said on Friday, September 12th, around 3:30 p.m., he stared at her while driving slowly past her as she walked near the BP gas station on Mohawk Drive. On Monday, September 15th, also around 3:30 p.m., the girl says the man slowed down and stared at her again while she was walking on Whenona Way near Mohawk Drive. She says during this second encounter he made a lewd gesture with his tongue. The man did not speak to the girl, and did not try to get her to come over to his car.

properties.Suspect: #1 suspicious person is described as a male, white, 5'5", 165 lbs., black hair, and brown eyes.#2 suspicious person is described as a male, white, 5'8", 170 lbs., black hair, and brown eyes.
properties.Details: On October 10th, around 4:05 p.m., a young Madison woman contacted police after allowing two men into her apartment. The victim says the men rang her doorbell around 3:50 p.m. that afternoon. She responded, and they explained they were with "ASPCA" - an association for the prevention of cruelty to animals based in New York. The men told the woman they had come to inspect her pets. She let them into her apartment where they proceeded to look at her dog. They then went upstairs to her bedroom to inspect her cat. Their conclusion was the feline was too skinny. About this time the woman realized this situation did not feel right. The men left without committing any crimes, but one did ask the woman if she was a model, and would she want to go on a date. Neither presented any identification.

properties.Arrested: 16 year-old female:  Disorderly Conduct, Batter, Obstructing an Officer, Unauthorized Presence on School Property16 year-old female:  Substantial Battery
properties.Details: On 3/17/05 at approximately 3:40 pm Madison Police responded to East High School (2222 E. Washington Ave) for a fight.  Two female 16 year-old students were involved in a fight on school property that resulted in injuries to both.  Several Madison Police officers responded to the school in an effort to stop the fight and investigate what occurred.  The incident is still under investigation.

properties.Arrested: Male/Black, stocky build, short afro 5'10-6'
properties.Victim: #1:  22 years-old, male,  broken jaw, Pardeeville, WI#2:  20 years-old, male, bruised eye, Wyocena, WI
properties.Details: On 4/7/2005 Madison Police took a report from two males who stated that they had been battered.  According to the victims, they were walking on 4/4/05 at approximately 2:30 a.m. in the 300 block of N. Henry St. when an unknown black male battered the two individuals.  This incident appears to have occurred without provocation.  As a result of the incident, the 22 year-old suffered a broken jaw, while the 20 year-old victim suffered a bruised eye.  The Madison Police Department is actively investigating this incident.  Anyone with information regarding this is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014 where they can remain anonymous and possibly be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Victim: 51 Year old female suffered head injury from being struck with a object during a fight.
properties.Details: Two families living in the 2400 block of Alled Dr. are involved in a ongoing dispute. This dispute turned into a fight today where the victim received a blow to her head. Shortly after this the victim who has previous serious health issues. stopped breathing. Madison Fire Paramedics revived the victim. Victim was transported to a Madison hospital where here condition is unknown.  This incident is still under investigation.

properties.Arrested: Timothy J. Clineofage 20. Madison Charge: Injury by negligent handling of a dangerous weapon.
properties.Victim: Suspects Girlfriend substained a stab type injury to her arm. She was treated and released from a Madison hospital.
properties.Details: Cline and his girlfriend were involved in arguement. During the arguement Cline produced a knive and attempted to destroy a jacket that the victim was wearing with the knive. Cline belived the jacket belonged to another male subject. As Cline was in the process of attempting to destroy the jacket the victim received a stab wound to the arm from the knive.

properties.Arrested: William Raleigh, 24, Madison:  substantial battery and disorderly conduct.
properties.Details: On 5/26/05 at approximately 12:57 a.m. Madison Police Officers were dispatched to a disturbance in the 700 block of University Ave, involving at least 6 people.  One result of the disturbance was an individual being treated at a local hospital for a lacerated lip and broken wrist.  The other result was charges for substantial battery on Raleigh and disorderly conduct charges for others involved.

properties.Arrested: N/A
properties.Victim: 42-year old male security officer.  Suffered head laceration that had to be closed with stitches.
properties.Details: At 10:37p on 6-18-05, Officers were sent to the 2300 blk of Carling Dr reference a battery.  Upon arrival, they located a security officer who had an obvious head injury.  The security officer informed the Officers that he was performing his duties and came across a large group of approximately 60 people in a parking lot and noted there was a fight going on.  He stated someone struck him from behind with either a stick or pipe and as he was moving away from the area, he was struck in the back of the head with either a brick or a rock.  The security officer was conveyed by Madison Fire to a local hospital, where his head laceration was closed with stitches. This is the same area where a shooting occurred several hours later and that was reported under Madison case number 2005-69403.  A press release was done related to that case number.

properties.Arrested: 1 juvenile: battery, disorderly conduct
