properties.Details: On 6/20/05 at approximately 8:30 p.m. the Madison Police Department responded to a battery complaint.  The victim told police he was rollerblading on the bike path near Verona Road when juveniles pushed him down and battered him.  Additionally, there were two separate reports of persons being battered on this stretch of bike path on Monday, 6/20.  The Madison Police Department is continuing the investigation into these incidents.  If anyone has additional information they are encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Adonius C. Bryant, 24, of MadisonCharge:  Substantial Battery, 2 counts of Battery and a warrantJeremy Sams, 21, of KentuckyCharge:  Endangering Safety by use of a dangerous weaponMichelle Kessenich, 21 of MadisonCharge:  2nd Reckless Endangering SafetyChristine E. Hamilton, 22, of KentuckyCharge:  DC while armed.Andrew J. Oliver, 24 or MadisonCharge:  Battery
properties.Victim: Adonius BryantInjuries:  Puncture left shoulder areaAndrew OliverInjuries:  Sutures to the temple area and under nose.
properties.Details: Bryant and friends arrived at a house party uninvited on 6-25-2006.  When confronted a fight ensued resulting in the above injuries to Andrew Oliver from Bryant.  Bryant was stabbed by a female,identified as Michelle Kessenich, in the left shoulder area.  A second individual, Jeremy Sams, waved a gun in front of Bryant demanding him to leave.Bryant was seen by Madison Police walking in the 600 block of Johnson with blood on his shirt.  Both Bryant and Oliver were treated and released.

properties.Arrested: Ross Harris, age 23, lives in 2500 blk of S Stoughton Rd.  Charges include 2nd Degree Reckless Endangering, Criminal Damage to Property, Disorderly Conduct, Battery, and Bail Jumping.  He was also arrested on seven outstanding criminal Warrants.  He is currently in the Dane County Jail.
properties.Victim: Adult female who had been in a domestic relationship with Harris.  She suffered numerous minor injuries, including bruises and swelling, scratches, minor lacerations, and swelling to her face and head area.
properties.Details: Madison Police were sent to a residence in the 2500 blk of S Stoughton Rd at approximately 3:01a on 7-5-05 reference a domestic disturbance.  Upon arrival, they contacted a noticeably distraught victim.Officers entered the residence and made contact with the suspect, who was holding an approximately 11-month old infant and refusing to put him down.  Officers spent a considerable amount of time trying to resolve this situation first and were ultimately able to do so.  They then interviewed the victim and she told them she became involved in a dispute with the suspect, who proceeded to punch her, force her to the floor, and ultimately attempted to choke her.  They learned that she's been in a domestic relationship with the suspect.After learning this information from the victim, they took the suspect into custody and conveyed him to the Dane County Jail.  Officers learned the subject had seven outstanding Warrants at the time of the incident.

properties.Arrested: 1 adult, 2 teenagers:  Battery, Physical Abuse to a Child (Party to a Crime)1 15 year-old male: Carrying a Concealed Weapon
properties.Victim: 15 year-old male:  treated and released at the scene
properties.Details: On 7/12/05 at approximately 12:30 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the West Towne Mall reference a battery complaint.  Officers learned that several teenagers were leaving summer school at Memorial H.S. when an argument ensued.  The confrontation carried over to West Towne Mall where a fight took place near the J.C. Penny loading docks.  During the course of the fistfight a weapon was produced.  A 15 year-old victim was hit in the mouth and head with this weapon.  The victim was treated and released at the scene.  Several individuals were partaking in this disturbance and at this time the Madison Police Department is still investigating. Crediting a quick response by officers and detectives, some of the suspects who had fled were apprehended away from the scene.  Further arrest information will be made available later.

properties.Arrested: Male/ 13 years oldMale/ 11 years oldMale/ 37 years old
properties.Victim: Jeff Anderson, (52 years old) - Minor injuries
properties.Details: On 8/2/05, at approximately 12PM, two juvenile males walk up to the victim (Anderson)and start striking him to both the head and leg area with broom handles.  Anderson, appauled by being attacked, defends himself by picking up the only item near him (Razor scooter - non-motorize foot bike) and throws it at the suspects to create distance between himself and the attackers/suspects.  After the scooter was thrown, one male suspect (11 year old) inadvertently trips over it as it fell to the ground, and the suspect finds himself beside the scooter; having sustained a lacerated upper lip from the impact of the fall.  That injury would require 5 stitches at the emergency room.  It seems the second male juvenile suspect (13 year old) was an accomplice and very much an instigator of the entire episode with Anderson.  He was charged with party to a crime of both Battery and Disorderly Conduct While Armed!The 37 year old male that was arrested in this scenario would deal with the police after all of the antics of his 11 year old son and 13 year old associate had run their course.  He would be arrested for Intimidating a Victim, Disorderly Conduct, and a Probation Violation/Hold for attempting to confront (in a violent manner) Anderson; thinking that Anderson had in some way attacked his son (11 year old suspect).  Police interviewed several reliable witnesses to make all arrest decisions.  The parents of the two juvenile suspects were counseled about their behavior in the absence of an authoritative figure.

properties.Arrested: 1 male-black 18-30 years old, 3 other suspects (unknown race)
properties.Details: On 8/12/2005 at approximately 11:20 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the 4300 block of Crawford Drive for an apparent home invasion.  Officers learned that 4 suspects entered the home disguising their faces and began to beat up the 52 year-old male victim as he was watching TV in his living room.  The suspects entered through the unlocked front door and left the same way.  At this point there is not an established motive as the victims were both in shock that this occurred.  The male victim did fight back, tearing a shirt off one of the suspects.  Both victims did not seek immediate medical attention and both estimate the incident lasted less than one minute.  Additionally nothing was stolen and no suspects have been apprehended.  If anyone has further information regarding this incident, they are encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Kenneth Dyer, white male,38, Madison:  Battery (2 counts) and Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: On 8/12/2005 at approximately 2:15 p.m. a Madison Police Officer was on routine patrol and came across what was later determined to be a road-rage incident.  The officer learned that a motorcyclist and a driver of a passenger vehicle apparently exchanged finger notions and words after the motorcyclist believed the vehicle had cut him off.  The motorcyclist, Dyer, also had a 10 year-old on the his motorcycle and feared the vehicle's driver did an intentional act in cutting him off while eastbound on Williamson St.  When the vehicle and motorcycle came to a traffic stop, Dyer came off his motorcycle and confronted the victim and the victim's passenger.  Dyer grabbed the victim's shirt and punched him.  At this point the officer arrived on scene and stopped this situation from escalating. The motorcyclist expressed remorse for having his 10 year-old passenger witness this incident.  Dyer was transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: Keane Singleton, 18, Madison.  Charges:  Physical Abuse to a Child, Recklessly Endangering Safety, Mayhem, False Imprisonment, Disorderly Conduct and 2 warrants
properties.Details: On 8/15/2005 at approximately 12:15 p.m. an astute taxi cab driver called Madison Police for what he believed to be a battery in progress.  When officers arrived, they noticed the 16 year-old victim was bleeding and had been battered.  As officers looked for the suspect and attended to the victim, parts of her ear were discovered on the ground.  The incident occurred when the victim tried to leave the abusive suspect, later identified as Singleton.  The violence that Singleton produced entailed throwing an object at the victim, choking her and hitting her.  Eventually as the victim was trying to leave, Singleton dragged her back inside several feet.  As the taxi cab driver witnessed this event, Singleton tried to downplay the event as protecting the victim.  The victim then was held by Singleton who would not let her go.  In holding the victim down, Singleton bit the victim's ear and rolled her over to bite off portions of her other ear.  Madison Fire/Rescue transported the victim to a local hospital, where she still remains.  Singleton was later apprehended.

properties.Arrested: Female, 14, Madison:  Disorderly Conduct, Battery to a School Official
properties.Details: On 9/14/2005 at approximately 11:37 a.m. the Memorial High School Education Resource Officer and school official were observing students near the cafeteria.  They observed several females run outside in a quick fashion in what appeared to be the onset of a fight.  In following the females, they observed two of them square off in a fighting stance.  The officer and school official got between the two individuals to separate them.  In doing so, one of the females hit the school official two times in the abdomen, causing pain.  The female was decentralized and handcuffed due to her violent aggression.  Subsequently she was removed from school and taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.  The school official did not seek medical attention.

properties.Arrested: M/W, 25-30 years-old, 5'8-5'9, 150-160 lbs, Brown hair, no facial hari
properties.Details: On 10/23/05 at approximately 2:28 a.m. Madison Police responded to a report of a disturbance in the 400 block of W. Gilman.  When police arrived, they noticed the victim was bleeding from the eye.  Police learned that some individuals had squared off in a fight, over bumping into each other on the sidewalk, when the victim was randomly hit.  In 2000 the victim had a cornea transplant.  As a result of this incident, the victim was punched in the same eye area and needed immediate emergency aid, as damage to the eye was apparent.  This case remains under investigation.  If anyone has information about this incident they are encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: John Williams, 49, Fitchburg
properties.Details: On 11/17/05 at approximately 12:45 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to a report of a fight in the locker room at the Princeton Club-West.  When officers arrived to the health club, the fight had ended and the individuals were separated.  Both individuals had been long-time members of the Princeton Club.  It was learned that in the locker room, Williams traditionally discussed politics with a third party and this generally included views on the President and war in Iraq.  The victim stated that he grew tired of this same dialogue each day and confronted Williams to change the subject.  More words were exchanged before Williams grabbed the victim's throat and punched him several times.  Both individuals suffered minor injuries.  Williams was charged with a misdemeanor battery.

properties.Arrested: Deandre Lewis, 19, Madison:  Disorderly Conduct, 2 misdemeanor warrants.17 year-old female, Madison: Physical Abuse to a Child, Disorderly Conduct, Resisting.5 Memorial female students cited (Disorderly Conduct) and released to parents
properties.Details: On 11/28/05 at 8:41 a.m. Madison Police responded to a disturbance in the parking lot Memorial H.S.  The original incident involved approximately 6 female Memorial H.S. students spitting on each other.  As they went into the school it became physical as punches and blows were being thrown.  A teacher was struck in the head at one point and did not seek medical attention.  As the 17 year-old female was being restrained by a police officer, she broke free and went into the principal’s office where another participant had been restrained.  The 17 year-old continued to batter that female until restrained.  Five more Madison Police Officers responded to Memorial H.S. for this incident.  The arrested 17 year-olds’ brother came to Memorial and became disorderly and even spit on a police officer.  He is identified as Deandre Lewis, who was also taken into custody for Disorderly Conduct and two misdemeanor warrants.  Beyond the 17 year-old female and Lewis, there were five other female Memorial students who were cited with Disorderly Conduct citations and released to their parents.

properties.Arrested: Female, 16, Madison:  BatteryFemale, 15, Madison:  Battery
properties.Details: On 12/14/05 at approximately 12:30 p.m. the Madison Police Education Resource Officer at Memorial H.S. responded to the principal's office for a battery investigation.  It was learned that two female students had left the school to go to Tree Ln to fight, for an undetermined reason.  During the course of the fight, one female hit the other in the temple area with a paddle lock, causing minor injury.  One of the females now at Memorial had attended an outlying school district and was asked to leave, prior to possible expulsion, because of her involvement in five other school fights.  While investigating this disturbance, officers had to attend to another, which stemmed from the original.  The two officers were able to deal with both situations simultaneously.  Both juveniles were transported to the Juvenile Reception Center.

properties.Arrested: 2 16 year-old males, LaFollette H.S.:  Battery, Intimidation of a Witness
properties.Victim: 42 year-old male, Madison:  treated on scene by Madison Fire/Rescue.
properties.Details: On 12/19/05 at approximately 2:44 p.m. Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the east bus transfer point on Corporate Drive for a disturbance.  It was learned that the male victim, while waiting for a bus, had told a group of five juveniles to quit pushing some females into the snow.  The group of juveniles confronted the victim and at one point the juveniles indicated the victim had a weapon.  No weapon was ever displayed, seen or found afterward.  The juveniles proceeded to punch the victim and push him to the ground before they started kicking him.  Witnesses interviewed later were crying at what they had seen stating, "it was just awful".  The victim was unable to get up until Fire/Rescue arrived for treatment.  The victim refused further medical treatment.  It was also learned that the group of students went to LaFollette H.S.  The suspects had threatened potential witnesses to not cooperate with the police.  Through an ongoing investigation, officers were able to make two arrests on 12/21.  If anyone has further information about this incident, they are encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Two (2) to Four (4) unknown suspects, concealed identity.
properties.Victim: Male 38 years of age: Suffered severe head injuries, was transported to local hospital and under went surgery. Condidtion unknown at time of release
properties.Details: Victim stated he was walking to his car when he was approached by suspects. Victim was struck in the head with an unknown object, and robbed of cash. Victim was later conveyed to local hospital by MFD for injuries.

properties.Arrested: Herman Ivey M/B 39 years old
properties.Details: Officers were dispatched to E. Dayton reference a fight upon arrival it was determined that Mr. Ivey had attacked another subject with a box cutter in a dispute over a pack of cigarettes. The victim sustained several non-life threatening injuries and was treated at a local hospital. Mr. Ivey was taken to the DCJ with several charges both suspect and victim were intoxicated at the time of the incident.

properties.Arrested: n/a
properties.Victim: 17 year-old Beloit Memorial H.S. Student:  ruptured spleen
properties.Details: The Madison Police Department is investigating a battery complaint as a result of a high school hockey game between Madison Memorial and Beloit Memorial on 1/24/06.  It was learned that a player from each team had collided and as a result the 17 year-old Beloit Memorial player was rushed to the hospital and had emergency surgery for a ruptured spleen.  It is alleged that the 15 year-old Memorial H.S. player used a hockey stick to strike the opposing player. No one has been arrested as this case remains under investigation by the Madison Police Department.

properties.Arrested: Charles Stokes, 17, Madison:  Battery/Hate Crime, Disorderly Conduct, Bail Jumping, Underage DrinkingMaurice Fox, 17, Madison: Obstructing, Battery/Hate Crime, Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: On 2/6/06 at 8:39 p.m. several Madison Police Officers responded to a fight inside East Towne Mall.  Officers learned that four males were fighting and were separated.  Stokes and Fox were with two other females and noticed the two victims in a store.  Stokes and Fox made offending comments to the victims about their sexual orientation and followed them out of the store.  The victims continued to avoid Stokes and Fox as they were being followed.  Stokes and Fox continued to make offending comments about the victim's sexual orientation and a fight ensued. The females, who originally did not want Stokes and Fox to pick a fight, were now encouraging the fight to continue.  Several witnesses in the mall were disturbed by this incident.  Officers arrived quickly and were able to ascertain that Stokes and Fox were the instigators in this disturbance.

properties.Arrested: Black male, mid 20's, approximately 5'8, wearing a black sweatshirt, knit cap and driving an older blue 4-door boxy car.
properties.Details: On 2/15/06 at approximately 1:09 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the 600 block of Howard Place for a battery/attempted robbery report.  Officers learned that the victim was walking in an alley, listening to headphones, when she was attacked from behind.  The suspect grabbed her and demanded she relinquish her I-pod.  The victim screamed and did not give anything to the suspect.  In return the suspect punched the victim approximately seven times in the face and pushed her to the ground.  Witnesses two blocks away heard the scream and called 911.  The victim suffered minor injuries and did not seek immediate medical attention.  This remains under investigation by the Madison Police Department.  Anyone with further information is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Male black wearing a white t-shirt and a baseball cap in a group of approximately 15 young male blacks.
properties.Victim: 24-year-old male resident of Madison walking alone. Victim was struck in the face by the suspect.
properties.Details: At approximately 12:43 a.m. on 05/06/2006, Madison police responded to a report of a male being struck by one member of a group of approximately 15 younger male blacks. Upon arrival, they contacted the victim, who indicated that he had been approached by the suspect described above who was one member of the group and that the suspect struck him in the face with a fist. He indicated that at this time the group broke up into smaller groups and fled. The victim did not require medical attention.

properties.Arrested: Unknown
properties.Victim: 22-year old male, UW student, and 22-year-old female, UW Student.  Facial trauma and bruising. Both victims have at least one eye swollen shut.  Both were treated and released at a local hospital.
properties.Details: Madison Police have become aware of another incident occurring downtown.  The police reports are not done at this time.  It appears the two victims were attacked from behind in the 200 block of N. Lake Street and knocked to the ground.  They were also kicked and punched.  Both have very obvious facial trauma from the injuries.  There is no description available on the suspects at this time.

properties.Arrested: Male, White, early to mid 20's, 6'2, 200 lbs with light blond hair.
properties.Details: On 5/21/06 at approximately 2:45 a.m. there was a brief disturbance in the 500 block of State St.  An individual celebrating his birthday sustained serious injuries to his head after being knocked to the ground from a punch to the face.  The suspect is described above and is still at large. Anyone with information about this incident is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Noah Williams, 19, Madison: Battery (Dane Co Jail); Lisco Turks, 18, Dodgeville: Battery (Dane Co Jail); David Carlos Plaza-Antuna, 18, Madison: Battery (Dane Co Jail); Christopher Taylor-Buckingham, 19, Madison: Disorderly Conduct (Dane County Jail); Peter Gargano, 18, Madison: Disorderly Conduct (Dane County Jail)
properties.Address: 300 block of Lake St/700 block of University Ave
properties.Details: On 5/28/06 at approximately 3:30 a.m. several police officers responded to a disturbance on Lake St/University Ave.  It was learned that the victim was walking from Brother's Bar on Lake St when a car, filled with the aforementioned arrestees, approached him yelling obscenities.  The victim continued to walk toward his own vehicle as the suspect vehicle followed and eventually stopped.  Williams allegedly got out of the suspect car, confronted the victim verbally and punched him in the face.  The victim, seeing he was outnumbered, did not fight back.  Williams continued the confrontation and placed the victim in a "head-lock".  The victim was now on the ground and the other arrestees engaged in the incident.  The victim's friends came running from Brother's Bar and took the victim away as the suspects fled.  The victim went back into the bar and a short time later exited to again leave in his vehicle.  The suspect vehicle was still waiting outside and the arrestees confronted the victim again trying to incite a fight.  The victim's friends came out of the bar to end the incident and this is when police arrived.

properties.Arrested: Raymundo Montes Juarez, 28, Madison: 1st degree reckless injuryPedro Ocotl-Jimenez, 18, Madison: 1st degree reckless injury
properties.Details: On 6/18/06 at approximately 8:15 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the 4400 block of Dwight Dr to investigate a battery report.  Officers learned that the incident actually occurred outside a Spanish grocery store on E. Washington and that the victim had come back to a residence on Dwight Drive.  The victim had left the Spanish grocery store and was approached by several males and was confronted verbally.  A fight ensued and one individual held the victim down to the ground, while the other individual struck him in the head with a large object several times.  In contacting the victim, officers immediately called for Fire/Rescue to transport him to the hospital as his injuries were described as severe with a copious amount of blood. On 6/22/06 detectives were able to arrest Juarez and Ocotl-Jimenez on the above charges.  The victim is out of the hospital after receiving medical treatment.

properties.Arrested: Equon (NMI) Hopkins, M/B, 03/01/1980, of MadisonCharges: 2nd Degree Reckless Endangering & Parole ViolationStatus: Dane County Jail
properties.Details: The Madison police has arrested a suspect in the investigation of a man who was pinned between two cars, injured and reportedly had a gun pointed at him in the early morning hours of 07/01/06. The suspect was identified as one of the drivers involved in the incident and is being held at the Dane County Jail on the charges mentioned above. The investigation is in a very active stage, and other suspects are still being sought.If you have information about this incident, please call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014. Callers to Crime Stoppers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward of up to a $1000 dollars.

properties.Arrested: Arrested: David C. Miller, M, 7-23-76, resident of Madison.  Charges: Substantial Battery x 3, Disorderly Conduct.Status: In custody at Dane Co. Jail.
properties.Victim: 3 Victims, males, ages 23, 27, 30. Two of the victims transported to local hospitals for treatment of injuries.
properties.Details: On 7/12/2006, at 9:54p, Madison Police responded to a reported fight in the 500 block of State St. Upon arrival, officers found several injured individuals prostrate on the ground, and another, the suspect, ID'd as Miller, being held to the ground. Witnesses reported that Miller had beaten the three men, resulting in two of the victims being transported to local hospitals for treatment of their injuries. Miller subsequently arrested at the scene. Motive in beatings unknown at this time.

properties.Arrested: Julio Cesar Alatorre-Sanchez, 21, Madison: Battery with a Weapon-Party to a Crime, Disorderly ConductErnesto Sanchez, 29 Madison: Disorderly Conduct
properties.Victim: Male, 25, Madison: minor injuries (bruised right forearm)
properties.Details: On 7/14/06 at approximately 12:36 a.m. Madison Police Officers responded to a disturbance in the 700 block of S. Whitney Way.  Officers learned that the victim was traveling with other people in his car when they ran out of gas and pulled into an apartment complex in the 700 block of S. Whitney Way.  They were immediately contacted by several individuals and engaged in a verbal argument.  The argument escalated and a physical fight ensued in which the victim was hit with a pipe or baseball bat.  Those who fled from the car were chased by the suspects with a pipe or baseball bat.  When officers returned to the scene, all four tires on vehicle had been punctured and were now flat.

properties.Arrested: 5 male suspects, 16-18 years old
properties.Details: On 7/16/06 at approximately 9:54 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the 1100 block of Morraine View Dr for a report of a battery that had just occurred.  Officers learned that the suspects surrounded the victim in an attempt to steal his basketball jersey he was wearing.  One individual punched the victim hard enough to break his nose.  As the victim's mother was nearby and tried to intervene, she and others were threatened with a baseball bat so as to not interfere.  As police were called, the suspects fled.  This remains an open investigation.  Anyone with information about this crime is encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: M/W, late 20's to early 30's, 6'2", thin build, shoulder-length medium brown colored hair and clean shaven.  He was last seen wearing shorts and athletic shoes.
properties.Victim: F/W, 20 years of age, of Madison sustained severe facial injuries.  She was treated and released from a local hospital.
properties.Details: The victim, was walking in the 100 block of Langdon St at approximately 1:15am, when she observed a M/W watching her while also walking on Langdon St.  The victim initially avoided this subject by crossing the street to a better lighted area.  Approximately 20 minutes later, the victim was walking again on Langdon and did not notice the suspect in the area.  The victim entered her apartment building and was between floors when she heard someone running up the stairs behind her.  The victim identified this person as the suspect she had seen earlier on Langdon.  The suspect proceeded to punch the victim multiple times to the face area.  The victim successfully fought the suspect off, tearing his shirt before he fled and nothing was taken from the victim during the attack.  The investigation is continuing and the suspect is still at large.

properties.Arrested: Kenneth Holden, 40, Madison: Battery, Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: On 8/18/06 at approximately 2:47 a.m. Madison Police Officers responded to Tenney Park for a battery in progress.  The officers learned that the female had been strangled by Holden and another individual.  Both individuals fled when police were approaching and Holden was eventually caught without incident. The other person got away. A witness had walked by, heard the woman being strangled and saw it in progress.  Both suspects switched in strangling the victim.  The witness did not intervene, out of fear, but immediately notified police.

properties.Arrested: Nickolas Brooks, 19, Madison: Mayhem, Battery-domestic, Disorderly Conduct-while armed, Bail Jumping
properties.Details: On 9/7/06 at 1:55 a.m. Madison Police Officers were dispatched to a battery complaint in the 2300 block of Allied Dr.  Upon arrival, officers made contact with the victim who was bandaging her partially severed thumb. Officers learned that Brooks had battered the female, as a result of a disturbance/argument in which Brooks was in possession of a handgun.  During the disturbance Brooks had bitten the thumb of the victim hard enough to cause it to partially sever.  Brooks fled the scene prior to police arrival.  Officers then learned of Brooks whereabouts in another apartment and effectuated the arrest without incident.

properties.Arrested: Hector O. Portillo-Velasco, age 33, Mazomanie, WICharge: BatteryStatus: Arrested/Conveyed to the Dane Co. Jail
properties.Victim: 32-year old male, resident of Madison. Suffered a fractured jaw and was conveyed to a local hospital for treatment.
properties.Details: At approx. 5:55 p.m. on 9/30/06 Madison Police responded to Elver Park regarding a 911 hang-up call.  Upon arrival Officers determined that there had been a disturbance during a soccer game, apparently caused by players disputing a call.  It was reported that some fans came onto the field and became involved in the situation.  Several players were attempting to separate the participants.  It appears the victim was one of these players.  It was reported that the suspect, who was a fan, came up and struck the victim in the face.

properties.Arrested: 16 year old male of Fitchburg, WI (Memorial HS Student - 11th grade) / Charge - Substantial Battery S.S. 940.19(2)16 year old male of Madison, WI (Memorial HS Student - 11th grade) / Charge -Substantial Battery S.S. 940.19(2)
properties.Victim: 18 year old male of Madison, WI (Memorial HS Student - 12th grade)Head/Face contusions & concussion
properties.Details: On 10/18/06 at approximately 12:00 noon, The Madison Police Department invesigated an incident involving a 12th grade Memorial High School student who was knocked unconscience after an altercation with two other 11th graders (associates) at the school.  It seems as if the altercation stemmed from all parties standing in line for lunch, and there being a misunderstanding about who had a rightful place in that line.  An arguement ensued, and one of the 11th grade suspects both pushed and punched the victim to the face/head.  The victim would fall to the ground after the violent attack, and the other 11th grade suspect would then proceed to kick (stomp) the victim to the head as he lie prone on the floor.  Witnesses communicated to police that the victim was unconscious for an undetermined amount of time.  The victim would later be transported to a local medical facility to undergo treatment for several face/head contusions and a possible concussion.  The suspects in this matter were both arrested on felony substantial battery charges, and were conveyed to JRC based on the seriousness of the offense.  PO Howard Payne

properties.Arrested: 1.  Suspect:  Nashieka M. Hogue, 17 year old female of Madison, Lafollette HS 12th grader – Charge - Physical Abuse to Child 948.03(2)(b) & Disorderly Conduct2.  Suspect/Victim:  16 year old female of Madison, Lafollette HS 11th grader–Charge – Disorderly Conduct3.  Suspect:  14 year old male of Madison, Lafollette HS 9th grader – Charge–Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: On 10/13/06 at approximately 2:02pm, Madison Police were called to Lafollette HS reference a disturbance.  Hogue allegedly got into an argument with the arrested 16-year-old female juvenile about whether or not the arrested 9th grade male had had an altercation with a cousin that also attends Lafollette HS.  The two females get involved in a fight where punches were thrown and High School Administrators had to physically intervene to deescalate this scenario.  Several Principals interjected; one principal had to cover the body of the 16 year old to keep Hogue from continuing to promote the fight.  This resulted in Hogue having an opportunity to kick the head/face of the 16-year-old female while she was being restrained on the ground.  The 16 year old sustained a 3-inch scratch to the right side of her face and nose pain (to be evaluated at a local medical facility).     The 14-year-old male, who is the younger sibling of the arrested 16-year-old female, was arrested on charges of Disorderly Conduct due to his creating a disturbance in the school and attempting to escalate the fight further.  Both Police and HS Administrators promptly dealt with this scenario and feel that incidents of this nature be approached in such a way to further the safety of all students.PO Howard Payne

properties.Arrested: 1. Dexter L. Watson, 17 year old male (11th Grade Memorial Student), Madison WI / Battery To School District Employee & Disorderly Conduct2. 16 year old male (10th Grade Memorial Student), Madison WI / Battery & Disorderly Conduct3. 14 year old male (9th Grade Memorial Student), Madison WI  /Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: On October 18th, 2006 at 8:05am, Police were dispatched to 201 S. Gammon Road (Madison Memorial High School) reference a disturbance.  Upon arrival, police would encounter the 3 parties listed above and a host of other agitated involved parties.  Watson allegedly confronts the 9th and 10th graders about spreading a rumor throughout the neighborhood about him.  It seems that there may have been an earlier altercation involving these parties in the recent week, and the basis for the rumor was a matter of contention for Watson.  As this verbal altercation ensued near the cafeteria of the school, Watson would disregard directives by school administrators to cease his threatening behavior, and proceeds to push past both a Principal and Dean to actively involve himself in a fight.  Both administrators of the school had to seek medical attention due to this ill-advised move on the part of Watson.   Watson would be arrested on two counts of Battery To School Employee & DC based on this scenario.   The 16-year-old arrested juvenile would be charged with battery for his involvement in striking a victim.  The 14-year-old male would be charged with DC for his involvement of creating/promoting the disturbance within the school.    Police and school administrators were able to calm this situation, but not without having to deal with a very complex set of circumstances.   Students need to realize that school administrators have the authority and responsibility to keep all within the school safe.  Students should adhere to all school related polices and understand that if they do not, police action will most liked result in serious charges being filed.  This is a situation that should not occur within the confines of school property, but young adults should have a greater opportunity to speak with parents about measures of conflict management/resolution!PO Howard Payne

properties.Arrested: Suspect; m/b, 6'1" to 6'2", 160-170 lbs., in his 20's, unshaven, last seen wearing a dark black or blue hoodie sweatshirt and baggie blue jeans
properties.Victim: victim received a minor injury to his head
properties.Details: On the above date and time, the victim was walking n/b on Murray Street when the suspect approached the victim (s/b on Murray Street).  As the suspect passed the victim, the suspect struck the victim on the head with a glass bottle.  The victim fled and the suspect gave chase.  The suspect then fled the area.  The suspect may have been with a second person who had a mask from the movie "Scream".

properties.Arrested: 2 black males, late teens/early 20's
properties.Details: On 12/18/06 at approximately 8:03 p.m. Madison Police responded to a robbery in the 600 block of Pine St.  It was learned that the victim had returned from the store and was in his own driveway.  As the victim locked his car doors, he went to the back of the vehicle to retrieve something from the trunk.  At this point one suspect near the car approached him.  He asked the suspect what he wanted and was immediately hit over the head with an instrument by a second suspect, knocking the victim to the ground.  The victim had never seen these two individuals before.  The victim yelled for help and his son came out of the home.  The two suspects fled on foot in a large box-style gray colored car.  A leather key holder was stolen from the victim.  If anyone has information about this crime, they are encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.

properties.Arrested: 3 black males, late teens
properties.Victim: Male, 42, Madison, transported to a hospital with minor injuriesMale, 27, Madison, minor injury
properties.Details: On 12/15/06 at approximately 5:45 p.m. a Madison Police Officer took a report involving a battery to two mall security guards.  It was learned that a security guard was confronting the three suspects about not smoking on the mall property, per policy.  The suspects, after uttering words, went toward their vehicle to leave.  One suspect turned and spit in the face of the security guard.  As that suspect went into a vehicle, he dropped his hat.  The security guard picked up the hat and the vehicle reversed to come back for it.  Two males jumped out of the vehicle and began to batter the security guard.  A second security guard came to the scene and tried to rescue his partner.  The second security guard was knocked down to the ground, kicked and stomped on in the neck area several times.  Eventually the suspects fled the parking lot/scene.  The 42 year-old male security guard was transported to a local hospital with minor injuries.  This remains an ongoing investigation by the Madison Police Department.

properties.Arrested: Dale Hook, 47, Blanchardville.  Misdemeanor charges of:  batter & resisting a police officer
properties.Details: On 12/14/2006 at approximately 2:55 p.m. Madison Police Officers responded to the Beltline @ Verona Rd for a fight in progress between two drivers.  It was learned that the precipitating factor was a road rage incident.  The two vehicles, a pick-up and a semi-truck, were driving close to each other and braking in front of each other.  Reports to the 911 Center confirmed these two vehicles were driving erratically on the Beltline.  An off-duty deputy had witnessed most of the behavior.  On the off-ramp of the Beltline at Verona Rd, the two drivers got out of their vehicles.  Hook punched the semi-driver in the face.  The semi-driver tackled Hook and held him down until police arrived.  Hook was resistive and suffered minor injuries before being cited and released at a local hospital.

properties.Arrested: Male, white, about 25, 6'1, thin build, blond hair.Female, White, 5'7, white coat, blond hair
properties.Victim: Male, 44, Milwaukee.  Cut below the eye, 8 stitches, fractured orbital.
properties.Details: On 1/18/07 at approximately 12:08 a.m. Madison Police responded to the Lava Lounge, on Gilman St, for a disturbance.  It was learned that two different tables of patrons were not engaged with each other through the night.  One table with the suspects (male and female) exited the bar.  The bartender noticed the female left her purse at the table.  The bartender went outside and called for the couple to return for the purse.  As they returned, the second table pointed out to the bartender that the male had left the bar with a glass of beer.  An argument ensued over leaving the premises with a beer.  Eventually the male suspect took an empty beer glass and threw it in the general direction of the other table.  The glass struck the victim in the head causing injury.  The suspects fled to a vehicle and left.  This remains an open investigation by the Madison Police Department.

properties.Arrested: multiple males
properties.Details: On 1/20/07 at 1:17 a.m. Madison Police responded to a disturbance on Curtis Ct.  It was learned that a male was severely beaten by multiple people with heavy-duty instruments.  The victim was with friends prior to the incident and ended up alone with the attackers.  The victim made it to a residential porch in which he contacted the homeowner.  During the contact, the victim's friends picked him back up and brought him to a Watertown hospital.  From that hospital it was determined that advanced medical treatment was needed, so the victim was brought to UW Hospital via Medflight.  The circumstances of this battery are still under investigation and there is no further information to release at this time.

properties.Arrested: 3 black males, all approximately 19-20 years old.
properties.Details: On 2/22/07 a Madison Police Officer took a report from a victim of a battery.  The victim had been battered, sought help at a hospital and emergency room personnel contacted MPD due to the nature of the injuries to the non-english speaking victim.  The officer learned that the victim was walking behind the Villager Mall on Park St in a parking lot when three black males approached him.  The males confronted the victim, punched him in the face multiple times and pushed him to the ground where they kicked him repeatedly.  The suspects then stole the victim's wallet.  The victim temporarily lost consciousness and eventually ended up at the hospital with cuts and bruises.  This remains an ongoing investigation.  If anyone has information to this crime, they are encouraged to call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014.  Callers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Male, black, 21-22, 5'7 stocky build, blue striped shirtMale, black, 19-10, 6', thin build
properties.Details: On 3/6/07 at 3:04 p.m. a Madison Police Officer investigated a battery report in the parking lot of Walgreens.  It was learned from the victim that as he entered a parking stall, he bumped another vehicle.  Dialogue was exchanged and a third vehicle entered the lot, appearing to be a friend of the suspect.  The two individuals demanded "something" from the 46 year-old male for striking the vehicle and due to him admitting he did not have insurance.  As the three were looking at the minor damage to the car, the two suspects turned on the victim and battered him.  The victim was punched approximately 15-20 times in the head area.  The suspects attempted to take the victim's walking stick, but were unsuccessful in striking him with it.  The suspects stole the victim's cellphone and then fled the area.

properties.Arrested: 3-4 teenaged, black females
properties.Details: On 3/23/07 at approximately 12:30 p.m. Madison Police responded to a battery report at Hilldale Mall.  It was learned that an 18 year-old female was with some friends dining in the mall.  As she went to a cash machine, 3-4 females approached her who then quickly sprayed an irritant into the victim’s eye.  The victim did not know these individuals and accounts indicate it was a random incident.  Nothing was stolen from the incident.  The victim had screamed and witnesses assisted the victim and police.  The victim was treated and released at a local hospital for the unknown substance sprayed to her eye.

properties.Arrested: Suspect:  M/W  mid-20s  red hair wearing dark clothes including:  sleeveless shirt, wind pants, white tennis shoes, black/white/gray camo baseball hat and carrying backpack.  Had tatoo on right arm.
properties.Details: Officers responded to a 911 hang up where they contacted victim and witness.  Victim reported suspect was trying to sell her items out of backpack.  Suspect then identified self as undercover police officer and told victim she was under arrest.  Suspect directed victim to walk off street and between houses where he attacked her.  Suspect fled when witness yelled at him.

properties.Arrested: Johnathan Linden, 29, Elkhorn:  2nd Deg Reckless Endangering Safety, Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: On 4/2/07 Linden was brought to Detox by Elkhorn Police.  Linden was upset for being at Detox and began disturbing the peace of the facility, so staff decided he needed to be placed in a seclusion room.  Upon entering the room, Linden put his full arm around a staff member's throat, strangling him.  Other staff were struggling with Linden as they tried to force him to let go of his strangle hold.  Several measures were tried on Linden to force him to release his strangle hold, but were unsuccessful.  Linden was also swinging punches and attempting to bite staff.  Staff members did report pain and non-life threatening injuries to the police officers.  Linden was then transported to the Dane County Jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: Male, White,  5'11, 185 lbs, mustache, black bb capMale, Black,  5'6, 240, blue t-shirt, blue jeans
properties.Details: The male victim was walking with a friend in the 200 block of W. Gilman on 4/14/07 at approximately 3:00 a.m.  They had just come from ordering a pizza and were walking home with their pizzabox when they were approached by the suspects, who were demanding the pizza.  The victim refused and was punched in the head.  A fight ensued and the victim ended up on top of the suspect, holding him down, preventing more fighting.  The suspect ended up biting the chin of the victim, severe enough for stitches, rolled back over the victim and punched him several times in the head.  Eventually someone took the suspect off the victim and they fled.

properties.Arrested: Ivan Quarles, 17, Madison:  Battery
properties.Details: On 4/19/07 the Madison East H.S. Education Resource Officer (ERO) was alerted to a disturbance in the school.  It was eventually learned that Quarles was outside on school property when a car went by and threw a paddle lock at him.  The lock hit Quarles in the face.  Quarles retaliated in battering a 15 year-old who he believed might have been involved.  A second incident had also broke out during this investigation, near the theater area, in which several other students were involved.  The ERO learned of growing tensions between gangs in the school and requested more officers to keep the peace.  Additional officers responded to the school and stayed for a presence until the school day ended. Quarles was arrested for battery and transported to the jail without incident.

properties.Arrested: Antonio L. Fleming (30 year old male)was charged with battery to a police officer.
properties.Victim: Madison police officer received a bite to the right side of the face.
properties.Details: On 4-28-07, Madison police officers transported Antonio Fleming to UW Hospital for an evaluation.  Once at the hospital, Fleming attacked the officers, biting one of them on the face.  Fleming was restrained with the assistance of other officers.  Fleming is currently in custody for battery to a police officer.  The officer was treated and released from UW Hospital.

properties.Arrested: Janice Garel, 25, Madison:  Substantial Battery, Domestic Disorderly Conduct, Disorderly Conduct (2 counts)Beatrice Garel, 24, Fitchburg:  Disorderly Conduct citation
properties.Victim: Female, 42, Madison: facial injuries, missing front tooth
properties.Details: On 5/13/07 at 3:28 a.m. eight Madison Police Officers and a WI State Trooper responded to a report of a disturbance in the 2900 block of Coho St where it was reported that a baseball bat and knife were in use.  It was learned that Janice Garel became upset over a phone conversation her friend had.  The argument grew against those who were still playing cards at that hour.  Janice called her sister, Beatrice, who came over and joined the disturbance.  The victim was attempting to de-escalate the disturbance, but eventually Janice struck the victim with a baseball bat in the mouth, causing a tooth to come out and other facial injuries.  Several involved in the disturbance had been drinking alcohol.

properties.Arrested: John Conley, 25, Madison:  Battery and Theft
properties.Details: On 5/13/07 at 4:42 p.m. Madison Police responded to a battery victim wanting to identify the suspect.  The battery had occurred on 4/2/07 and the victim had seen the suspect on 5/13/07 walking on W. Badger Rd. She followed him until police arrived. The victim said she had recognized the features of the suspect, Conley, and was convinced it was him.  The alert victim contacted officers, who did their own investigation and arrested Conley on the above charges.

properties.Arrested: 5 Hispanic Males
properties.Details: On Monday evening an injured 20-year-old Madison man was found by a concerned citizen walking near the West Beltline. The citizen then called 911. Police responded. The victim said 5 men in the 1700 Block of Fish Hatchery Road had jumped him. He suffered head and neck injuries and was treated and released at a local hospital.Anyone with information about the case is urged to call Crimestoppers at 266-6014. Callers may be eligible for a cash reward.

properties.Arrested: Male, Age 13, MadisonMale, Age 12, Madison, Male, Age 10, MadisonMale, Age 8, Madison
properties.Details: On June 5th, at 7:17 p.m., Madison Police were called to a restaurant's parking lot for a report of juveniles who were out of control. Also on scene was a Madison cab driver. He reported being attacked while the young men/boys were being transported in the back of his taxi. The victim says he was struck several times, and responding officers found a large bump on the back of his head. Officers handcuffed the two older suspects because of their unruliness. They continued to fight with officers even after being cuffed. Eventually a total of 8 officers were called to the scene to gain control. While being transported the older 2 suspects remained out of control inside squad cars, kicking and screaming. The 3 oldest suspects were charged with Disorderly Conduct and Battery. The 2 oldest were also charged with Resisting.

properties.Arrested: Morris E. GreengrassAge 44, MadisonTentative Charge:Disorderly Conduct
properties.Details: On June 13 at 3:22 p.m. Madison Police were called to the 6900 Block of Mineral Point Road following a report of a substantial battery. It was learned by witnesses, including a Madison Metro Bus driver that the above suspect had been making racial taunts towards a group of young African-American teens while riding a city bus. The driver told Greengrass to stop the slurs or he would have to get off the bus. Greengrass failed to heed the warning. He was politely asked to exist the bus, which he did. Some of those on the receiving end of the taunts also got off. Greengrass was punched and taken to a local hospital. Officers found no probable cause to arrest any of the teens.

properties.Arrested: Suspects at Large: 1)white male, 22-30 yrs old, 6'0" average build, short hair, wearing blue cap, blue longsleeve t-shirt and painter-style blue jeans 2)white male, 21-30 yrs old, 6'2" average build, ear-length hair, stubble beard, wearing black NY Yankees cap, pin-striped NY Yankees jersey and blue jeans 3)white male, no further desc.
properties.Victim: 22 yr old male, Madison resident, suffered stab wound to the foot.
properties.Details: Victim was walking in the 500 block of W Wilson St when he was approached by three white males, who then pushed him to the ground and attempted to rob him.  During the course of the altercation, one of the suspects stabbed the victim in the foot with a pencil.  Suspects fled on foot and were not located.  Victim was treated at a local hospital for non-life-threatening injuries.

properties.Arrested: Male, Age 15, MadisonTentatively charged with 2 counts of BatteryMale, age 16, MadisonTentatively charged with Disorderly Conduct & Resisting a Police OfficerMale, age 16, MadisonTentatively charged with Disorderly Conduct & Resisting a Police Officer
properties.Details: On June 28th at 10:42 a.m. Madison Police responded to East High School for a report of a fight. The victim says he was in class when the suspect (the one charged with battery) rushed in and began punching him. The same suspect then, according to the victim, attacked again as the victim was trying to make his way to the principal's office to report the first battery. Two other teens were also arrested. One reportedly acted as a "look-out" for the battery suspect. The third person arrested is a brother to the victim. He was upset because his brother had been injured and became disorderly by trying to get at those who had injured his brother while police were in the process of making arrests.

properties.Arrested: Male Hispanic, early 20's, heavy build, chubby face, last seen wearing a white t-shirt
properties.Details: Early Sunday morning, shortly after midnight, Madison Police responded to a convenience store on Northport Drive where a pizza delivery driver had gone to seek help. The bloodied driver, who had 2 cuts to his head, told officers he had been doing his job in the 1600 block of Delaware Blvd. when a car he was driving behind stopped. This forced him also to stop. He says a very angry man, who appeared to be intoxicated, got out of the passenger seat of the suspect car. The victim says the man swore at him and made statements such as, "get out of here, whitey." The victim says he tried to explain he was just doing his job. As he tried to leave he says the suspect hurled something at the passenger side window of his car. The window broke. Officers found a large rust-colored brick in the back of the pizza deliveryman's car. He was taken to a local hospital. His injuries required many stitches.

properties.Arrested: Adam W. Corona, age 28, Brooklyn WICourtney R. Kirchstein, age 21, Brooklyn WIBoth arrested and tenatively charged with:2 counts of Battery1 count Disorderly Conduct

properties.Details: On Sunday night around 10:04 p.m. Madison Police responded to the Hilton Hotel. There they came into contact with a couple (the arrested persons listed above) that appeared to be very intoxicated. Officers said both were out of control. The male half was being detained by a security guard who had intervened following a disturbance inside the lobby of the hotel. One victim, a 21-year-old man, who had just finished the Ironman told officers the arrested couple attacked him, his father, and his grandfather, and that the primary aggressor had been Mr. Corona. The 21-year-old victim said he had just finished the Ironman five minutes earlier, and because he legs were very wobbly, he was being helped back to the hotel by his family members when Mr. Corona and Ms. Kirchstein bumped into them on the sidewalk. The 21 year old says he told the couple he had just finished the Ironman and to get out of his way. He says Mr. Corona responded with several expletives, including, "I'm going to kick your a--!" The 21 year old says his grandfather was scratched in the face and pushed over some bushes during the ensuing altercation, and that Corona punched his father in the head. The 21 year old, who is also a wrestler, then put Corona in a headlock. During this time the 21 year old says Mr. Corona was punching wildly, and in fact, one of the blows landed on his (the 21 year old's) nose. Police arrested Corona and Kirchstein despite their claims that they were the ones who were assaulted.

properties.Details: On Saturday, September 15th, around 1:45 a.m. Madison Police responded to a disturbance outside of a State Street bar. While en route, a cab driver flagged down police, and told an officer that three men had surrounded a member of the Guardian Angels. An officer then located the Guardian Angel member. He led police to the Frances Street ramp where the three men listed above were located. The Guardian Angel states that earlier he had intervened in an escalating confrontation between the three suspects and another group on State Street. He told the three (listed above) to go home. He says they in turn they ended up circling and taunting him, making statements like, "Guardian Angel fly away." During this time he says one of the men struck in twice in the head with an open hand. He (the Guardian Angel) was calling 911 when police arrived at the scene.

properties.Details: On Saturday night, around 8:41 p.m., several Madison Police Officers responded to State Street Brats for a fight call. Inside the bar several men associated with a bachelor party were involved in a large fight. Bar staff told police that earlier, one of the men, Nicholas Bradbury (brother to the bachelor) had been cut off from receiving additional alcohol. After that they say he began to fight, or wrestle, with another member of the group. It escalated, and eventually bouncers and police were in the middle of a melee. Mr. Nicholas Bradbury was the recipient of a taser deployment during the scuffle. One officer, and a couple of bouncers, suffered injuries during the fight. One bouncer hit his head on the floor, another was punched, and the officer was hit in the head.

The victim told police his girlfriend's vehicle had recently been broken into while parked in the area, and he decided to camp out inside his car to see if the suspect (s) might come back. The victim reports that he was a couple of hours into his stake out when the driver's side door opened. The victim jumped out and got into a shoving match with one of the suspects. He (the victim) says that suspect then punched him (the victim) in the face. The victim says the suspect, and an accomplice, ran westbound along Tree Lane.

properties.Details: On September 30th, around 12:19 a.m., Madison police were dispatched to the ER at UW Hospital. A 13 year-old West High School freshman was being treated for a head injury. The young man reported that he and other friends had attended the homecoming dance, and were walking along Regent Street. He says he stopped to tie his shoe, and lost site of his friends for a few minutes. During those moments he reports that a group of males, three of whom he remembers as being black, came walking towards him. The teen does not remember being hit, but says he blacked out. When he came to he was missing a shoe and his cell phone.

properties.Details: On October 3rd Madison police were dispatched around 9:12 p.m. to a Park Street gas station for a battery complaint. A store employee reports that he believed the above suspect was about to steal items from his place of business. As the victim questioned the suspect about his intentions, the suspect belted him (the victim) in the nose. The victim believed his nose was now broken. Private security officers engaged the suspect in a foot pursuit as he fled past Meriter Hospital. UW Police later found the suspect at the McDonald's on Regent Street. He initially gave Madison police a bogus name, but later admitted he was Mr. Redd.

properties.Details: On Thursday morning October 11, 2007 seven Madison Police officers and some 30 Lafollette High School staff members were needed to breakup a disturbance at the school around 11:15 a.m.. Officers learned that two adult women and two teenage boys (one of the woman is the mother of one of the boys) came to Lafollette where they confronted another teenage boy in a hallway. The boy, who was confronted, reportedly had gotten into a fight with the other two outside of school earlier in the week. He (the boy confronted) said the group of four circled him and the two adult women encouraged the young men to fight. Staff, hearing the ruckus, responded. Some of them (the staff) reported that the two women were shouting and threatening the teenage boy who had been surrounded. During the resulting melee a security guard was "stomped on" by Ms. Barry (who is the mother mentioned above) as he (the security guard) tried to restrain one of the two teens that had come to school with her that morning. A school official told police he was very disturbed by having adults, who don’t belong on school property, coming to school to confront “kids”, saying that the education of hundreds of others had to be disrupted so staff could deal with the scuffle.

properties.Details: On Friday evening October 12th at 10:48 p.m. Madison police were called to a report of an armed robbery in the downtown area. A 19-year-old UW student says he was walking in the middle of the street on Conklin Place when he was approached by a group of young men. One of them (the 14 year old listed above) pulled a knife and demanded the victim's wallet. Another (the 16 year old listed above) then punched the victim in the head. The victim says the 14-year old also clobbered him several times with a closed fist. He feared he was going to be stabbed. Just as this was happening a cab drove into the area. The victim walked backwards towards the cab and yelled for the driver to call police. He says just as he got in the cab the 14-year old smashed the knife down onto the taxi.  Officers arrived in the area and were able to arrest the two suspects. The victim never gave up his wallet.

He says he was kicked and punched and later struck multiple times with a fencepost that resembled a baseball bat. During the melee he says his dog was also hit with the chunk of wood. He said he does not have money to take the dog to a vet, and he indicated he and his dog would be moving on, up the highway, after this altercation

properties.Details: On Saturday February 2nd around 2:57 p.m. Madison Police were called to the Warner Park Community Center after a Madison School Community Recreation (MSCR) basketball game erupted into a melee. One account given by witnesses suggests that some "trash talking" and a "hard" foul gave way to a scrum involving players from both teams as well as some fans who had been in the stands. Several adults, including parents, tried to intervene. This resulted in one dad taking a punch to the face. The blow broke his nose. A 17-year-old was arrested for the battery. He was also accused of leaping into the stands and swinging at other people. When police arrived 40 to 50 students and adults were in the lobby of the rec center. properties.Details: On Tuesday afternoon a La Follette High School principal was attempting to escort to the office a couple of students who had been arguing. One student (the 16 year old listed above) did not want to go to the office and became hostile. She began yelling and ended up punching the principal in the face. A Madison Police officer witnessed the act. That officer was also punched in the face while arresting the student. The melee took place during class passing time, and the arresting officer described the situation in a report as "extremely disturbing and disruptive to the school environment." Following the arrest pepper spray and a box cutter were found to be in the 16-year-old's possession. These were grounds for additional tentative charges. The student also spit her gum on the floor, which is a violation of Madison's Expectorating Ordinance. A 14-year-old student --who had been involved in the initial argument -- was arrested on Disorderly Conduct charges.

Instead the victim got into a tussle with the gunman, which ended when the perpetrator struck the victim in the face with the weapon. The perpetrator then walked away westbound onto West Washington Avenue.

properties.Details: On March 18th at 2:11 a.m. Madison Police were called to the 400 block of West Mifflin Street where two UW-Madison students had just fended off a would be purse thief. The 21-year old female victims say they were walking southbound on North Broom Street . They were approaching West Mifflin Street when they noticed the perpetrator coming toward them. The man said nothing, but put one of the women in a headlock. She fell down and he kicked her in the face and side. He grabbed her purse and attempted to yank it away. However, the woman began kicking the man back while her friend blasted him with repeated blows as she used her purse as a weapon. The women announced they were calling the police and the assailant ran off empty handed.

properties.Suspect: Jason M. Denault, age 32, MadisonMr. Denault was arrested and tentatively charged with Battery to a Police Officer, First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, & Operating a Motor Vehicle While Under the Influence.
properties.Details: On Monday afternoon, around 5:30, Madison Police were advised that there was a reckless driver operating in the area of Park Street and West Washington Avenue. A few minutes later an officer was dispatched to Fish Hatchery Road just north of Wingra Drive after motorists reported the car was now stopped in traffic. The officer found approximately 20 cars backed up behind the suspect vehicle – all were in the right hand lane of Fish Hatchery. The officer determined a black Mitsubishi Galant (the suspect car) was in drive but not moving because the driver -- who appeared to be asleep -- had his foot on the brake. The officer tried knocking but could not get the driver to respond. Next the officer opened the driver's side door and ordered the driver to put the car in park. The driver responded by swearing at the officer, and by taking his foot off of the brake. The Galant coasted forward and collided with the rear of the officer's squad car. The officer reached across the Mitsubishi and placed it in park. He then tried to remove the suspect from the driver's seat. The suspect responded by placing the vehicle in reverse. The officer next turned off the car. A struggle ensued and the suspect ended up punching the officer in the face multiple times. A second officer arrived and assisted with getting the suspect in custody. The officer suffered a couple of cuts and bruises.

The more seriously injured victim says he and his friend (the second victim) were at the South Transfer Point when rival gang members jumped them. The victims were taken to a local hospital for treatment.

The two soccer players, both of whom are Asian, said they were just about to head out. The 24-year-old says the larger group started throwing out racial slurs, and he was punched. The blow sent him to the ground. Next he says he was stepped on and kicked by members of the larger group. His 21-year-old friend ran for help and called police. The victim suffered a black eye, a bloody nose and lip. The perpetrators also stole the soccer ball.

properties.Details: On Thursday afternoon, around 1:39 p.m., Madison Police responded to a battery that had just occurred in the 400 block of West Dayton Street. Witnesses say the suspect cold-cocked the victim as the victim was looking at discarded items in a trashcan. Police were also told the attacker picked up a rock or brick and used the object to increase the power of his punches as he repeatedly battered the victim. The victim told officers he used to be a friend of the suspect, and explained that this assault had started when the suspect punched him on State Street a short time before the West Dayton Street incident. The suspect threatened to kill the victim and he indicated to arresting officers that this violence was over a woman. During the struggle the suspect threw a vodka bottle at the victim, and placed him in a chokehold. The Madison Police Department will ask that the suspect be placed on the State Street ban list.

He was told that the flowers were there for everyone to enjoy, but he kept insisting that a flower be given to him. Upon receiving the flower he continued to be argumentative and then proceeded to punch the victim in the face. Witalison received minor facial injuries. Hurley, who has no permanent address, was arrested for Batter and taken to the Dane County Jail.

properties.Details: On July 1st an employee of a Dane County based temporary employment agency reported to Madison Police that he had been attacked by a fellow worker at a Lien Road job site around 1:15 p.m. on June 30, 2008. The victim reported that he was initially reluctant to report the battery for fear of jeopardizing his employment. He told officers that he and others were working near loading docks of a company when the suspect began making racial insults towards him and other employees of color. The victim says the suspect started saying things like, "Go back to Chicago where you're from," while making racial slurs including the “n” word. This was followed by the suspect spraying paint thinner at two of the aforementioned employees. He then threw the spray bottle at the primary victim hitting him in the face. Next the suspect grabbed a sharp piece of metal and started swinging it at the face of the 48-year-old man. The victim blocked the swings with his hand and suffered a puncture wound. At this point other employees broke up the attack. The suspect was arrested at his Fitchburg residence Tuesday evening (July 1st). During the arrest he struggled with officers and threatened to do harm to black and Mexican people. He was shouting about how “they” take the jobs

properties.Details: Early Sunday morning, at 12:30 a.m., Madison Police were called to the 100 block of Breese Terrace after a caller indicated there might have been some type of battery. The caller based this on the fact that she overheard someone walking by her state he had just severely injured an unknown person. No victims were found in the area, but at 1:30 a.m. an injured man victim #1 arrived at a local hospital with help from victim #2, and a Good Samaritan. Victim #2 told police that he and victim #1 had indeed been walking along Breese Terrace sometime after midnight when they encountered a group of guys on the sidewalk. He says victim #1 may have accidentally bumped into one of the men. Victim #2 said victim #1 apologized, but that three men started following them. Victim #2 says perpetrator #2 ended up tackling victim #1 and proceeded to punch him multiple times in the face. Victim #2 says perpetrator #1 then began to kick victim #1 multiple times in the head. Victim #2 says he was also struck once in the head while trying to help his friend. He says the third man, who had trailed them along with the two perpetrators, was also attempting to stop the attack. Victim #2 says a stranger the Good Samaritan also came to their aid, and this man carried his friend victim #1 to the hospital.Anyone with information on the identity of the perpetrators is urged to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014.

properties.Suspect: Marc R. Grewe, age 24, Great Falls, MontanaMr. Grewe was arrested and tentatively charged with Substantial Battery.
properties.Address: 602 University Avenue outside of Wando's bar
properties.Victim: Male, age 23, Lodi Victim lost a tooth and suffered facial cuts.
properties.Details: On Wednesday morning, around 1:42 a.m., Madison Police were dispatched to a report of a man down outside of Wando's bar. Witnesses say the victim had gotten into an argument with another man, and that the suspect ended up punching the victim. The blow knocked the victim backward and onto the ground. He appeared to be unconscious. One witness further states that while the victim was in this condition the suspect punched him in the head a couple of more times. The suspect's description was broad to other officers, and one of them spotted him near Lake Street and University Avenue.

properties.Suspect: Gregory D. Wilson, age 33, MadisonMr. Wilson was arrested and tentatively charged with Substantial Battery, Domestic Disorderly Conduct, and Resisting & Obstructing an Officer
properties.Victim: Female, 20’s, MadisonVictim suffered multiple head and torso injuries.
properties.Details: On Saturday night, around 7:36 p.m., several officers responded to the 2400 block of Brentwood Parkway after dispatch received a call indicating a man was beating a woman with a chair. When police arrived the suspect ran, but was tracked down quickly with the help of concerned citizens. The victim indicated she had been seated in a metal folding chair outside of her home when a man, with whom she has had a long-term relationship, began yelling at her.  This evolved into an attack as the man began hitting the woman in the head with the chair. The suspect threatened to kill his victim, and stomped on her chest with both feet, He also punched her in the face. Several concerned citizens came to the woman’s aid, and the victim was eventually able to run to safety after the suspect took off towards one who was trying to stop the violence.	The arrested party, Mr. Gregory Wilson, is the same man identified by Madison police as the suspect in a battery to a Madison Metro driver this past July.  There is an earlier incident report posted regarding that crime.

properties.Suspect: Samuel L. Edwards, age 22, MadisonMr. Edwards was arrested and tentatively charged with Substantial Battery, Battery, and Resisting an Officer.
properties.Victim: Male, age 23, MadisonSecurity guard was punched in the eye. The injury required stitches.Male, age 20, MadisonVictim suffered a black eye.
properties.Details: Early Wednesday morning, around 12:18 a.m., Madison Police were called to Club 5, 5 Applegate Court, for a battery complaint. A club patron says the suspect made disparaging remarks about gay people before punching him in the face. A security guard intervened and was also struck by the suspect. Responding officers located and arrested the suspect as he was walking away from the nightclub.

properties.Victim: Male, age 39, MadisonVictim suffered a head cut.
properties.Details: On September 1, 2008, around 4:28 a.m., a concerned citizen contacted Madison Police after seeing a man, with an obvious head injury, biking on Packers Avenue. The victim was intoxicated and initially had difficulty remembering what had happened to him. He later recalled that around 1:30 a.m. three men pushed him off his bike and battered him. He believes they took his wallet. The victim had no description of his attackers other to say there were black, and he thought they were traveling in a white SUV.

properties.Victim: Male, age 26, MadisonVictim suffered a bump to the head.
properties.Details: On Thursday night, around 9:45 p.m., a 26-year old Madison man reported he had been struck with some type of glass object a little over an hour earlier - around 8:30 p.m. The victim said he said he was outside the Hartmeyer Ice Arena, near some large trash bins, when someone hit him in the head. He says the perpetrator patted him down, and he believes this may have been an attempted robbery. The victim says he never saw the person who hit him, and that he had been in the area doing some stretching while out for a run.

properties.Suspect: Perpetrator #1 is described as a male, Latino, age 18, 5'7", short hair, thin, wearing a black "hoodie" and blue jeans.Perpetrator #2 is described as a male, Latino, age 16, 5'6", ear length hair that was slicked back, pudgy build, wearing a light brown argyle checkered short sleeve t-shirt.Perpetrator #3 is described male, Latino, age 16, wearing a black "hoodie."Perpetrator #4 is described as a male, Latino, age 16.
properties.Victim: Male, age 16, MadisonVictim was treated for pepper spray.
properties.Details: On September 28, 2008, shortly after 8:00 p.m., a 16-year old Madison resident reported to Madison Police that he was attacked that evening while walking along Post Road near Coho Street. He says another teen approached him, and that this teen was armed with pepper spray. He could also see that there were three other perpetrators nearby. The victim ended up getting spray in his eyes, and falling to the ground. He says he was kicked several times after falling. He went to a local hospital for treatment for the pepper spray. The victim is not sure why he was targeted, but says one of the perpetrators thought he - the victim - had beat up the perpetrator in the past.

properties.Suspect: Nathan Beck, M/W, age 25, from Chicago.  Charges: Battery to P.O. and Disorderly Conduct
properties.Arrested: Melissa Horn, F/W, age 25, from Chicago.  Charge:  Obstructing Police
properties.Details: Officers responded to an unwanted subject at 123 E. Doty St.  When officers arrived, apparently the problem was resolved.  Officers noted an individual in the intersection striking a motorist.  Officer intervened and was struck by suspect, who was arrested.  While officers were dealing with suspect Beck, his friend Horn kept interfering.  The officers eventually arrested Horn for Obstructing.  The injured officer was able to return to duty.

properties.Suspect: Chad Richard James, age 31, MadisonMr. James was arrested and tentatively charged with Physical Abuse to a Child, Disorderly Conduct, Probation Hold, Operating a Motor Vehicle While under the Influence, & Operating After Revocation.
properties.Victim: Male, age 15, MadisonVictim suffered facial cuts and bruises.
properties.Details: On Friday night, around 10:12 p.m., Madison Police were called to the McDonald's restaurant parking lot on Verona Road. A 15-year old African American male reported that a Caucasian man driving a green pickup truck had made racial slurs toward him. The victim says he and the man exchanged words, and that the man ended up getting out of the truck. He says the suspect pushed him to the ground, and punched him several times. A friend of the victim pulled the suspect off of the victim. The friend says he ended up kicking the suspect several times.

properties.Suspect: Jordan R. Vance, age 27, JanesvilleMr. Vance was arrested and tentatively charged with Battery to a Police Animal, State Statute 951.0951.
properties.Details: Early Sunday morning, around 12:06 a.m., a 27-year old Janesville man was arrested for battery - not to a person - but to a police horse. The suspect was one in a group of five men who had approached three Madison Police officers as they sat atop of their mounts near the intersection of State and Lake Streets. The officers were observing the bar crowd. The men asked to pet the horses, and were given permission to do so. Upon completion of the petting, the suspect slapped one horse very hard on the rump. The mounted officer said on scale of one to ten, this strike was a ten. The officer's horse leapt forward in a dangerous manner, almost causing the officer to be unseated. The officer said such a sudden movement could also endanger community members.The suspect apologized immediately, and was placed under arrest for Battery to a Police Animal.

properties.Victim: Female, age 16, MadisonVictim suffered abrasions, but did not go to a hospital.
